b'Welcome to The Rileys attracted me more and more as the movie progressed; At first I thought it was a bit slow, but when the pace soared against the backdrop of New Orleans, I was quite impressed by what I had to say. The casting could not have been better; Melissa Leo offers an excellent performance as a guilty housewife punishing herself for a car accident a long time ago that took the life of her daughter; and James Gandolfini presents a masterful performance as her husband Doug, who seems unable to overcome his pain and his personal demons. Choreography and cinematography improve the film and the musical score also does a great job in making the film even better. Lois Riley (Melissa Leo) and her husband Doug (James Gandolfini) are still very unhappy despite the fact that eight years have passed. years since the death of his daughter in a car accident. Lois has not left the house since the car accident; in fact, Lois has been so depressed that she already has tombstones for herself and Doug by the grave of her dead daughter, a fact that gives Doug chills. Doug also has a long relationship with a waitress named Vivian (Eisa Davis). However, when Vivian suddenly dies of a heart attack, Doug is very upset and still sad; and he suffers in silence because he does not know that Lois already knew about him and Vivian for quite some time. Doug goes to a business convention in New Orleans; and still annoyed by the death of Vivian (who had wanted to take her there for his birthday) and also feeling out of place in a city very different from where he lives with his wife, Doug leaves the convention early one day and goes into a fringe where he meets a minor prostitute who has several different names, including Mallory (Kristen Stewart of the fame of `` Twilight \'\'). Doug and Mallory start an unconventional relationship; She reminds Doug of her daughter. So, what does Doug do? Call Lois to tell her that she will stay in New Orleans indefinitely without giving Lois any reason; he moves in with Mallory paying her $ 100 per day to stay with her in her badly damaged apartment in a house that was abandoned after Hurricane Katrina and Doug desperately tries to get Mallory to grow up with a combination of love and confrontation that Mallory needs. Meanwhile, Lois finally decides to leave home after nearly eight years of staying indoors: she is determined to go to New Orleans and find Doug there by calling him on his cell phone. Of course, the rest of what happens gives us a very solid story and good entertainment. I could tell you more; but there will not be spoilers here, although it may seem like I already told you too much! Suffice it to say that the rest of the plot should keep their attention very well. Also, look for very good performances by Tiffany Coty as Tara and Lance E. Nichols in a brief presentation as Hamilton "Ham" Watkins, another entrepreneur at the convention. The DVD also includes an extra on the making of the film. I recommend this movie for anyone interested in family drama or drama in general; and, of course, the fanatics of the actors in this movie would do well to add this to their collections.'

b"One Body Too Many a black and white film from 1944 is not an especially good movie. BUT, it's a funny movie. It is a silly horror movie / comedy type B that became the meat and potatoes of so many early studies. I love him . Jack Haley is Albert Tuttle a nose for the stone insurance man who has a date with an old rich inmate. He arrives at his mansion and is seen by the butler (Bela Lugosi). He shows up at his client's office and immediately begins his speech towards the back of a chair and the smoke that comes out of a lit cigar. However, without Tuttle knowing, the client is dead and in his coffin in the office. Tuttle places his briefcase on the closed casket before realizing what is in the room. When you try to leave, you can not open the door, etc. This movie is full of all imaginable clich\xc3\xa9s. But that's fun. A huge, dark creepy house, a desire to read, a suspicious looking butler and cook, a beautiful damsel in distress, a naive detective, a house full of greedy members of the family of the deceased, murders, trap doors, screams and night noises, etc. Of course, a very nervous and reluctant hero. This kind of movie would be nothing without Lyle Talbot and he is here as the family member who thinks that the shy Jack Haley has something to hide. I've had this movie for years and from time to time I dust it off to see it again because sometimes you need some harmless fun. (~. ~)"

b'This beautiful film is set in Miramont Place, Pimlico (a district of South London). When an unexploded bomb detonates from World War II, local shopkeeper Stanley Holloway discovers an ancient treasure of garbage, which includes a mysterious document. An eccentric university professor (Margaret Rutherford) translates the document, and proves that Miramont Place was the place where King Edward IV delivered the palace to the Duke of Burgundy in exile, converting the inhabitants of Miramont Place into natives of Burgundy instead of in Great Britain. Locals go crazy, tear up their ration books and keep the local bar open all night, they have a great time until the government gets nasty and starts cracking down on them. Enter a French dishy who turns out to be the current Duke, come to claim his inheritance and save his subjects from the iron hand of the bureaucracy. Under siege, the defiant Burgundians make the decision to stop the underground trains and pass the passengers through customs, the government retaliates by closing the water supply, who will win in the battle of ingenuity? If you are a fan of the eccentric British comedy, this film is a classic of the genre.'

b'CHARLOTTE SOMETIMES is a night of a movie, a story that gently meanders through the lives of four people and with very few words says a lot about human relationships, about the cocoons that we turn on ourselves for security, for protection against fear, to wait for the chrysalis to metamorphose into a butterfly or moth. Eric Byler is praiseworthy for having the courage to keep this story simple: a story of four personality "upsets" and how they find the means to exist in this strange world. Michael Idemoto is perhaps the most lonely on the outside, but the four characters seem to crave the connection and simply can not stick. Eugenia Yuan is the idiosyncratic girl, Jacquelyn Kim is the mystery woman who with Matt Westmore interprets more a catalytic agent than a character. The four actors are beautiful, sensitive and convincing. The lighting and the configuration are well chosen. In general, this small independent film is a silent distraction, which deals more with what is not said than with just a script.'

b"After reading the user's review of MOUSEENEER, I'm glad I did not wait for the uncut version, although I had it on Laserdisc, I did not feel that it added much more scope to the movie, the only thing that's different, the crime scene at the beginning it's a bit more graphic, the sex scene of Michael Douglas and Sharon Stone is a bit more revealing, (he performs oral sex on her that is quite vivid), apart from that this movie is like the R version, This is a hell of a psychological roller coaster, but it's a good one, it can be perceived as a sex movie, but it's a police thriller that keeps you guessing until the end, and you're still not sure who the killer is, it's been said in the media that Douglas and Stone hated each other in this movie (they could not get along) although you can not tell if you look, it would not be hard to believe, given the ego of Douglas and Stone, despite this, it's a very police thriller Well it should not be gnored, and Sharon Stone looks better here, honestly, I can not say now, since she cut her long blond hair (not wise) but here she looks like Catherine Trammel, a role that rejected Julia Roberts, Stone It is perfect here and this will always be your best role."

b"I think that in the next few decades, when film school students study the history of American animation, Iron Giant will be perhaps the last great example of traditional hand-drawn animated films, before the switch to computerized animation to search of Nemo. The saddest thing What happens with this film is that when it was originally released in cinemas, its promotion was so little financed and simply bad, that it was not very successful. Fortunately, he has received devout followers on VHS and DVD. This movie is an example of what animated films usually achieve in Japan, but they rarely do it here in the United States. It is well written, it is visually impressive and it works for all ages, not only for children. Keep in mind that it may not be suitable for very young children. The climactic battle sequence presents a potentially terrifying transformation of the Iron Giant. Do not get me wrong, this movie is suitable for everyone, but younger viewers and most very young children can probably handle it well. But some children are more sensitive and prone to nightmares than others, so if you have children under 6, I suggest you watch the movie before you allow them to watch it. Some films are better rented, others are better bought. This is in the last category: it is a guardian! If you are an adult who has canceled animated films like `` children's things '' because they tend to be trivial and formulaic, you owe it to yourself to watch this movie. Many reviewers are so pleased that they appear. Unable to give less than 5 stars, which is a shame, because this is a movie that deserves to stand out from the crowd, and got its rating of 5 stars."

b'I have been watching this animated program for the last 10 years, now I am 20 years old. Honestly, I can say that I still can not find anything wrong with Gargoyles. With a captivating story, an adorable cast and wonderful music, I give this show a 2-thumbed look. I am happy that, after 10 long years, I can finally have the gargoyles in my house. BRAVO Disney!'

b"After spying this series on the shelves of my local library and seeing that it was an aspiring chef established in 1900-1910 in London, I collected all the volumes. This series really surprised me: it has a strong writing and attention to the environment. . Louisa Trotter is an open cockney cook who makes her way in her profession and in British society with a lot of coda, an understanding of human nature and some luck. Gemma Jones is great because Louisa Trotter and the supporting cast are also very solid. At first I was not sure if this series was a miniseries or a television series (It's TV), but it is rather Dickensian since each episode is based on the previous one. And I can pay a series without a higher complement than saying that conflict resolutions are not trivial or superficial. Many allusions to historically precise facts, politics and contemporary culture are woven into the stories. I feel that I learned more about the English classicism and the social customs of the `` Duchess '' and the Bentinck Hotel than about my semester abroad in London. If you like vintage drama (and comedy) and strong and nuanced heroines with many battles to fight, then you'll like `` The Duchess of Duke Street. '' This series stands the test of time. My only complaint is that I did not learn much about the culinary arts, but the writing is so above standard that my complaint becomes inconsequential. Although this series began filming in 1976, production values \xe2\x80\x8b\xe2\x80\x8bmake it difficult to locate. The Duchess of Duke Street is comparable in quality to the Pride and Prejudice of the 1979 BBC."

b'While this is an excellent adaptation of the first 24 chapters more or less than J.K. Rowling\'s book, the initial releases of Harry Potter\'s home videos continue to disappoint with its astonishingly scarce bonus materials and lack of documentaries. It is obvious that this film, including its current special features, will finally be released as: 1. An `` Ultimate Edition \'\' with new special features, 2. In a `` Complete movie collection \'\' with all other movies, and 3. Possibly as an "Extended Edition" combined with Part 2. So, why in the world would it be foolish to pay $ 15-25 for this now? If you are an unconditional fan who simply can not wait to have this, I guess I understand, but you just have to rent it and save your money for later. Otherwise, this is a blatant attempt by Warner Bros. to continually get people out of their money. And that\'s not great with me.'

b"After having seen this movie several times, I definitely have to rate Gigi as one of the most charming musicals ever made. The delightful score, by Lerner & Loewe, includes songs like `` I Remember It Well '', `` The Night They Invented Champagne '', '' Thank Heaven For Little Girls '', and the song that gives title to the album, `` Gigi '', sung with surprising candor and seriousness by Louis Jourdan. The three directors, Leslie Caron, Louis Jourdan and Maurice Chevalier, along with the Paris locals help maintain a distinctive French flavor, especially in the way the characters relate and interact. For all those who have commented on the political impropriety of the story, a closer look will reveal the true feminist perspective of Colette's work, which was a pioneer at the time: 1) the story is a commentary on limited social and economic options for women out of wedlock (or prostitution for that matter) during the turn of the century, 2) Although Gigi (Caron) never fully masters her lessons and preparation, she is able to capture the heart of Gaston (Jourdan) precisely because of her imperfections, and 3) most importantly, it is Gaston instead of Gigi who is forced to truly transform and challenge the social conventions of the time to bring history to its resolution. Compare this with My Fair Lady, which offers similar social commentary, but is resolved in a more standard way; Although Professor Higgins finally realizes his love for Eliza in the end, it is Eliza who is forced to submit his will to make a reconciliation that does nothing to resolve any of the issues raised in the scenes prior to that point. Definitely go to Gigi and judge for yourself. (Make sure you see only the widescreen version!) The full-screen version is awful, with full characters cut out from some scenes, like Hermione Gingold in most of the `'I Remember It Well '' sequence."

b"This is one of my favorites & quot; small & quot; films; very real, very honest and with a great soundtrack. We saw the play too and we loved it. This DVD, however, is a Chinese (Japanese?) Pressing without extras. I returned it and I'm still waiting for the American release. Caveat Emptor."

b'The Limey is probably the best work of Soderbergh, beats Traffic and Erin Brockovich with ease, only Out of Sight and Sex, Lies and Videotape are close. The Limey is one of the only movies I\'ve seen where the stylistic possibilities of the film make the film not only a piece of indulgent art to be debated in film classes, but a moving film that resonates and stays with you. Terence Stamp plays the main character Wilson as a tough and sad English criminal trying to find out what happened to his daughter. Your search has gender fundamentals, but this movie rises above any gender label. It takes a lot of credit for the Lem Dobbs script, which dodges the clich\xc3\xa9 and injects a good comedy into the mix. But the editing style of this movie is what I love, it works on waves like "memorys", it\'s the only movie I\'ve seen that shows precisely how your mind can change from one thing to another. Right now, I\'m sounding like an art student with chins dominated by his own personal importance. But watch the movie and you\'ll see what I mean. The best part of this movie is that it\'s sad, the ending is not a big spin or a copy, it\'s just sad, and there are not many movies that evoke that feeling in me today. I\'ve finished .'

b"This old television special consists of 10 cartoons, using only about 3 minutes of that caricature. I would have got 5 stars if the cartoons were complete. For some inexplicable reason, the Easter Bunny calls the grandmother to tell her that she is sick and that she can not distribute the Easter eggs. Granny believes that Bugs Bunny would be a good substitute, so he goes to the Warner Brothers Studio where Bugs is filming 3-minute segments to complete his cartoons. Here you must sit through the various recordings and projections of Looney Tunes Cartoon segments to try to talk with Bugs.The new animation is quite poor and Mel's vocal work is weak (well, it's older). It's hard to tell that this poor material was produced and directed by veterans Looney Toonists FRIZ FRELENG & BOB McKIMSON.Oh, and since this was for the children, all of Elmer Fudd's shots have been removed from the television special. (NOT by Warner for the DVD.) Used cartoon clips from: 1) Knighty Knight Bugs2) Hillbilly Hare3) Bully for Bugs4) Tweety's Circus (Tweety & Sylvester) 5) Birds Anonymous (Tweety & Sylvester) 6) For Scent- Reason Imental (Pepe Le Pew) 7) Rabbit Of Seville8) Foghorn Leghorn cartoon9) Robin Hood Daffy (Daffy & Porky) * almost complete, only the end has been removed to segway back to the new animation. * 10) Sahara Hare. COMPLETE COMPLETE CARTOON: YOUR STORY THAT WILL RAISE THE HARE - basically a cartoon in which Bugs tells his nephew about his various adventures in 8 minutes, this means very short clips. So unless you want to collect all Looney Tunes, wait for the cartoon collections of Bugs Bunny & Daffy Duck in April to appear with complete cartoons. Bugs Bunny: Hare Extraordinaire (Looney Tunes Super Stars) Lucas Duck: Frustrated Fowl (Looney Tunes Super Stars) On a positive note: June Foray gets credit on screen for expressing Granny, something that is usually overlooked in voice credits (but we knew it was her)."

b'It is not very challenging! I bought this video when I started training but I never did. Later I started doing many videos of Denise Austin, including her yoga workouts. They were great and, as I progressed, I thought maybe I was ready to try Yoga Conditioning for Weight Loss. I would say that this video is ideal for relaxation, but since when does that add up to fat burning or weight loss?'

b'For those of you who have read the wonderful novel on which this film was based, the only advice I can give you is to not see it. b"Jerry Lewis is Jerome Littlefield, an assistant in a mental institution who acts crazier than patients. Since Frank Tashlin directed this film, Jerry is free to concentrate solely on his performance, which he does perfectly. Once again, Jerry is the lovable loser, who was expelled from medical school because he felt the symptoms of every patient he diagnosed. This film presents a lot of excellent visual gags. Jerry arranges a television in the room of a patient who has a bad reception, also known as snow. When you pull out the front of the TV, the snow blows off the stage and soon fills the room! A patient has a full-body cast from head to toe, which looks like a cast mummy. Jerry accidentally hits him, the patient rolls down a hill and hits a tree. There are pieces of broken plaster everywhere, but there is no body! Jerry declares, & quot; I lost a patient! & quot; The film concludes with one of the craziest chase scenes in film history, when a stretcher with wheels and an injured man leaves the back of an ambulance and continues rolling down the hills, while the first and then two ambulances they're chasing him. This movie features more LPM (laughs per minute) than most modern comedies, and is one of Jerry's funniest movies."

b"Where is your house ? The place that matters most to you Where you want to say something to other people. Where somewhere means something to you. Mac, who works for the head of the oil company (Burt Lancaster), more interested in astronomy than the next big oil field, based in Houston, where he makes million dollar deals by phone before brunch, is sent to a remote Scottish coastal village, to negotiate a large refinery project. At first, the ultra slow pace of the locals' life frustrates him: why can not he close the deal and go home? But then the magic of the place begins to seep into him. The things he thought really mattered were not that important. And genuinely important things in life begin to reveal themselves. And Mac finds his true home. Fun, carefree (everyone gets what they want, nobody loses) but movingly, this movie is a rare thing, one that makes you feel good anyway, indefinitely. Somewhere, there is a phone ringing, someone calling home. Where are you going to call tonight?"

b'A great adventure in the style of Monty Python. Always hard to find on DVD, it was a pleasant surprise to see it relaunched. Unfortunately, this version is designed for television, and twenty-five minutes shorter than my original VHS version. At some points, the editing done to shorten the film is amateur, and the generic water sounds used to fatten up the original audio for surround sound are more of a distraction than an increase in the movie. I will keep my VHS tape while I wait for a real DVD release.'

b"Synopsis: John Ritter plays Roy Knable, a real couch potato whose life and marriage disintegrate around his ears as he watches television escape everything. The same night that his wife Helen (Pam Dawber) tries to leave him, a mysterious salesman named Spike (Jeffrey Jones) seems to sell Roy a new television set, complete with a gigantic satellite dish that will transmit 666 channels to Roy's living room . However, something goes wrong when Roy and his wife are absorbed by the satellite dish and enter the infernal world of Satan TV. From there, it's a frantic hurry to survive before time runs out. About the movie: Stay Tuned is probably one of my favorite comedy movies. The first time I saw it was in the early 90's and when I saw it had been released on DVD, I took the opportunity to get it. Stay Tuned is full of slapstick humor, a large number of very twisted comedies about classic television clich\xc3\xa9s and eacute; s and TV programs. Among them are Saturday Night Live, Star Trek, The Next Generation, Three's Company, WWF and classic cartoons. The cartoon is presented in a wonderfully charming animated sequence that was actually supervised in production by the legendary animator Chuck Jones (who did many of the cartoons of Bugs Bunny and Daffy Duck). This is really the top of the movies starring John Ritter. Ritter's comic time helps make this movie. While this film never received much attention, it is undoubtedly an excellent example of why John Ritter's comedy career spanned more than 2 decades. It was very good as it did. Veteran comedian Eugene Levy (`` SCTV '' and `` American Pie '') also plays an important role in this film as Crowley, a Hell TV Exec that helps the Knables on their journey. He manages to play the adorable slimeball quite entertaining. Jeffrey Jones plays the bad guy, the Hell TV CEO, Spike. He is a great actor for the bad guy in a comedy, and he manages to be convincingly evil and funny at the same time without making the role look stupid, as the bad guys often do in slapstick comedies these days. With John Ritter's comic timing and Pam Dawber playing the heterosexual man as they fall from the insane channel to the insane channel, this movie is great for a lot of laughs. About the DVD: Stay Tuned comes in a cardboard DVD case, marking it as a cheap rate. It is presented in widescreen format with Dolby Digital 5.1 sound. Both the image and the sound are quite good. I did not notice any problems with either of them. The DVD has been translated into French (why not in Spanish?) And has subtitles in English, French and Spanish. For special features, the DVD comes with an extended theatrical trailer, information about the cast and a behind-the-scenes look of the film. The cast information is simply a list of actors in the film. They do not even provide biographies, so this is a clear case of increasing the content with minimal effort. The featurette is the kind they used to show on television right before the movie came out, with interviews with the cast that are completely enlightening if you've seen the movie. It's only slightly interesting. The downside is that the music played behind the commentator is downright annoying during the first quarter. This DVD release is a fairly simple standard release. In general, a great movie in a little exciting DVD release. 4 stars"

b'So many HD DVDs contain only what was on the original DVD in the form of extras, but not this one. Along with a high-quality HD DVD transfer, the disc contained other significant extras, including a second movie, "The Invisible Boy" and a television show, along with other appearances by Robby the Robert. In a word, hours and hours of quality additions.'

This is the most incredible stupidity on the part of the producers of these DVDs or (more likely) is a deceptive attempt to change the sales of additional DVDs to people who would like to see the end of the stories started in this set. . It can not be accidental to have 1 but 2 incomplete stories! I highly recommend not wasting money on this pair of DVDs.'

'' and they would not laugh at their horrible acting and the stupid script. b'If I have not said this before I\'ll say it again, I\'m a huge fan of George A. Romero\'s Night Of The Living Dead and its sequels that he\'s done over the past forty years. Thanks to him, we know the horrible world of Zombies and the Undead in great detail and we know in what terrifying place you can be trapped, be it an old farm, a suburban shopping center, an underground bunker or any place that leaves you open an attack of the heaters of the living. Of course, once you create such a popular character in Horror, you get an imitation scam trying to capitalize on your original creation. Oddly enough, most of these types of films have had varying degrees of success, especially the Italian Zombie filmmakers of the eighties. Unfortunately, the one that started it all, the 1968 NOTLD, due to a copyright attack, never got that precious right and it soon became clear to everyone that anyone could release it, own it and / or do any version with that. plot and title in any way they choose. But first, a bit of history: in 1998 Anchor Bay and John A. Russo (one of the men to help create the original 68 with Romero) decided to launch a 30th Anniversary version of the classic, but instead of simply returning to publish the same old print as any other DVD company, I film and add new footage with the previous one, creating a new subplot that not only damages the original movie, but betrays the social commentary that was established in The First Place. A real mistake and the fans were not happy. However, when it came to completing remakes, at least someone understood it even before this. In 1990, with the personal guidance of Romero and FX genius Tom Savini at the helm, they made a movie of Night Of The Living Dead that stayed close to the original screenplay, giving the 90\'s audience an update that did not they could only be proud, but better in some aspects of the bloody and production values. So, after a well done remake and a learning error in what should not be done to a classic, could it ever happen again? Apparently not . In 2006, with director Jeff `` Corman Wanna-Be \'\' Broadstreet in the chair, they decided to give it a try again, of course, without the necessary consent of Romero, but this time with a twist: Let\'s try to do in 3D ! 3D? For real ? It sounds like a curious idea, but it really stays flat here. Being frank NOTLD3D is a parody. Filmed with a nonexistent budget, this has to be the worst "reinvention" of a movie since 2001 Planet Of The Apes. Sure, most of your favorite characters are here, but this time mixed and played by actors who are so rigid, it\'s hard to distinguish them from real zombies. And the story is so slow and boring that it seems like a 3 o\'clock viewing of something you\'d expect to see on Sci-Fi Channel. In addition, although the gore factor in the original 68 was minimal at best, 36 years later still not much is seen, or nothing, but not for reasons of MPAA but financial, and in fact, halfway I I asked why was this \'\' R \'\' qualified in the first place? The new twists of the plot were unconvincing, the boring sets, and the cameo of the newly crowned Horror icon Sid Haig (which in my opinion is not that big in the first place) is completely unnecessary and only helps in establishing that this was what last in cash -ins of movies. So your main attraction has to be your 3D, right? Incorrect . Instead of using the latest stereoscopic 3D technology (which has the "shades of gray"), they used the old-fashioned anaglyphic type (red / blue) which in turn turns the whole film into a mess of purple tones. And do not expect anything to "jump" you. When it works, and it\'s weird, it only provides depth of background, which means that it makes the image look deeper, not closer. It should also be borne in mind that, apart from the behind-the-scenes features, this whole album is in 3D, which means that without the glasses, it is impossible to see. There is no 2D version on the disc included as it should have been (that version is released separately), so once those glasses go, it\'s the best roller coaster. In short, bad movie, bad 3D, bad idea. It was remade in 1990, and eight years later it received a trick that did not work either. Even as a movie alone, a scam like Day Of The Dead 2: Contagium is a better movie. Difficult to suggest, even if you are a completista like me, NOTLD3D is a dead movie that should have been buried. (RedSabbath Rating: 3.0 / 10)'

b"It would be difficult to formulate a coherent film composed of the disparate elements that the director and others obviously felt compelled to include within this scenario, but a worthy attempt is made, which collapses after the first half. A pre-Columbian ceremonial disc, gold and jeweled, has been divided, and while half is displayed in a permanent collection of the museum of the city of New York, the other segment has become the subject of a search expedition to an Andean region , under the aegis of American archaeologist Brooks Willings (David Keith), who is obsessed with achieving his recovery. His wife and daughter remained in New York, but when young Diana (Camilla Belle) became a disciplinary problem at their school, they join Brooks in the Andean town where his expedition is, hoping his wife will correct the anguish of Diana's behavior. , just to be overwhelmed by additional problems that originate in your new situation. Continuity fails at this point when Diana becomes entangled in the mystic rites of the town, Brooks and his wife (skillfully played by Nancy Allen) fall into serious marital discord, a Catholic priest, portrayed with humor by John Rhys-Davies is tormented by the local cultists, the expedition has developed a shortage of personnel and funding, and others, too many threads to interweave in a consummate plot. To solve its great self-imposed conundra, the work becomes a silly fantasy, including silly special effects, as an easy resolution. Keith is wooden, manifestly uninspired by his role, but Belle is effective and the Rhys-Davies moment is worthy of study, while the laurels act for the magnificent oriental Indian Roshan Seth, who easily dominates each of his scenes in the part of a shaman with extraordinary wisdom and magical powers. Filmed in the picturesque province of Salta, in northern Argentina, the image benefits from both M\xc3\xa1ximo Munzi's cinematography and Luis Bacalov's faithfully ethnic score; if only one way had been seen to strengthen the stuttering scenario."

b'The following story will tell you why this movie was a bomb at the box office. While visiting a family in Miami, one of my cousins \xe2\x80\x8b\xe2\x80\x8bwent to see the movie. "I could see that the bulb went on over his head and he went straight out and saw it again, it goes without saying that he loved the movie, as I did, it is not often that a big star has the guts to make fun of himself just to make your fans laugh, so if you have this movie languishing in your collection somewhere, you need to see it with this in mind, it\'s a parody, satire, comedy, look at it and have fun.'

b"We should all congratulate Uwe Boll. It's like a kind of cinematic cockroach. No matter how little talent he has, and no matter how bad these films are, he manages to keep doing it. I know, he funds them all through some kind of strange German background, but even so, his ability to continue making films despite total and absolute failure is one of the great mysteries of the universe. It would not be so bad except that video game developers continue to give their best properties to this guy. I really enjoyed the Alone in the Dark series of games. Even the last one, the New Nightmare, was good for a few hours of play. There was a good movie to make of the adventures of Edward Carnby, but this is not all. Now Uwe Boll has in his hands Bloodrayne and Hunter: the Reckoning. What's next, Silent Hill? Doom? I can only imagine the range that this guy is going to cut through game-to-movie adaptations if he does not stop. Someone has to take away your line of credit, or these video game publishers must realize and realize that when they make a bad movie of a game that kills the franchise, no one is interested in that title anymore. Think about it. , is House of the Dead or Alone in the Dark a viable game title? No way . A new game of House of the Dead goes out for XBox and nobody cares about it. The title is dead, and all for Uwe Boll. So, if one of you works for a game editor, or knows a game editor, or has access to a game editor ... please let them know. This movie in itself does not even deserve to be reviewed. I can not separate what I did not like from this pile of manure from the rest. Literally, everything about that sucks. Writing, acting, music, CG effects, editing. I thought that if I waited until it came out on DVD and then I rented it with few expectations, I would not be disappointed. Even the $ 5 you will spend on this DVD if you buy it used at one of the Amazon sellers is too much. You will regret it . This movie is just a bunch of Boll."

b"Harvey Pekar's comic, American Splendor pioneered a new genre: the autobiographical comic. At first glance, the day-to-day events of a Cleveland file clerk hardly seem like the material for an interesting movie. Fortunately, filmmakers Robert Pulcini and Shari Springer Berman are able to understand the fun, heartbreaking and fascinating life of Pekar and adapt successfully from the panels of the page to the big screen. Like Ghost World, American Splendor defends outsiders who do not fit with society in general. In a nice touch, comes a mini comic book with the DVD that briefly recounts the experience of Pekar with the adaptation of his comic in a movie. The album features an interesting audio commentary with the real Harvey Pekar, his wife Joyce, his daughter Danielle, his friend Toby Radloff, the filmmakers Robert Pulcini and Shari Springer Berman, and actor Paul Giamatti. Everyone has a lot of fun on this track while they joke and remember the movie and their experiences. `` Road to Splendor '' is a brief update of what Harvey has been doing since the film was made. The song, `` American Splendor '', by Eytan Mirsky, which appeared in the film can be heard in its entirety. His voice sounds mysteriously like Evan Dando of the Lemonheads. Finally, there is a theatrical trailer for the movie. American Splendor has the same ironic sense of humor and melancholy as Ghost World, another excellent film adaptation of an independent comic. American Splendor remains true to the vision of Pekar: refuses to sentimentalize his life, even in the emotional conclusion of the film, which is really moving. It is one of the best adaptations of comics that have been filmed, as it remains faithful to its original material and with wisdom it involves its creator in the process of transferring its story from the page to the screen."

b'The film is a strange animal, it\'s fine, a work without gender, and sometimes Gordon seems to have surpassed himself, looking for effects that he is not able to achieve. The different styles, moods and genres give the film a somewhat garish, amateurish look, but in the end (perhaps consciously on Gordon\'s part) this clumsiness works in favor of the film. The Singing Detective is a remarkably naive, fresh and daring play, almost childish in its lack of pretension, and easily one of the most original American films of the last twenty years. Above all, it shows the pulp writer afflicted and bitter about the disease of Robert Downey Jr., within whose head the whole film takes place (more or less), and Downey offers an inventive and powerful performance, which may be the apotheosis of his enormous talent Despite praise for Downey, in his release, Gordon\'s film was met with a wall of critical resistance, a true consensus of contempt. This may be due in part (at least in the United Kingdom) to the fondness for the original Potter television series; but perhaps it was more due to the basic incompatibility of Potter\'s idiosyncratic and scathing vision with the main tastes (critics). Whatever the case may be, the movie once again failed tragically to find its audience. As in his previous adaptations, Gordon respected the original material without rebelling, and as a director, has a rare gift: the ability to fuse his own sensitivity and talent. with its theme at a fundamental level. In the case of The Singing Detective, it was a somewhat less perfect fusion; Potter\'s vision (his strange mixture of musical fantasy with somber psychological realism) was so surprisingly original that it required another sensitivity at least as strong and eccentric to merge. Gordon still does not possess (yet) the surrealistic gifts to make Potter\'s vision his own, or take it to the next level (David Lynch could be the only director capable of that). He is a competent director in every way, and seems to be blessed with a natural relationship with the actors (maybe why so many good guys want to work with him). However, Gordon is not a visionary director, and this was a visionary script. Fortunately, he had a visionary actor in his professional heyday to take over, and Downey takes the day. The Singing Detective is not a masterpiece; it is defective and fractured and sometimes thin, even easy and occasionally redundant (especially in pseudo-noir sequences). But it is an imaginative and intrepid piece of cinema, an admirably eccentric work that manages to do something like justice in brilliant writing. Filled with witty delights and touches of heart, it leaves most of the recent movies of Americans in the dust. However, it failed a lot, both in the United Kingdom and in the USA. UU., And it was revised so little that many people (myself included) missed him, suspicious of the stench of failure. It so happened that the bad smells did not come from the film but from critics who were too corrupt and jaded to recognize a work of art when they saw it. (Excerpt from "True to the Muse: Life on the Periphery of Keith Gordon," by DOGVILLE VS. HOLLYWOOD, by Jake Horsley)'

b'Watching this musical on a stage in New York is a difficult experience to overcome and I went and saw it four times. But seeing it on film is a totally flat experience. It just does not work on the screen for me. Although you have a cast of great talent, the incredible energy and electricity that is screwed on stage are not here. The musical is a primordial story based around the village, full of people living on the edge. As I lived in New York for 30 years, I instantly felt at home with this hidden world that the average person can not imagine. But spending two hours in a movie theater, seeing this story wet and depressing, is a dark experience. The musical numbers seem all forced. The people are not very nice. They are too dramatic and intense for the comfort zone and the reason why the movie broke out, is that Central America probably could not understand why the people in this movie simply did not pay the cursed rent, and they avoided all the drama and problems! This movie went very well in the big cities where there were people who could identify with this story of tragedy and AIDS. But even for someone like me, who is very familiar with this world, which takes place in the Village, where I lived, it is a depressing and depressing experience with very little to feel optimistic. I can not sympathize with junkies and prosthetics or any of the musical numbers were electrified. They should have obtained a new and fresh cast for the film version and opened it more from the dark, always damp world that surrounds this cinematic treatment.'

b'The "Exorcist" by William Friedkin is a milestone. The cultural psyche has still faltered since its arrival on the scene more than thirty years ago. It is a masterpiece that will continue to endure long after many horror films of today are forgotten. Actress Chris MacNeil (Ellen Burstyn) seeks the help of Father Damien Karras (Jason Miller) after her daughter Regan (Linda Blair) begins to behave strangely. Realizing that something is terribly wrong with the girl, Father Lankester Merrin (Max von Sydow) is summoned to carry out an exorcism with her. Then there is a terrible battle between the forces of good and evil that pushes all involved to their physical and spiritual breakpoints. Words can not convey the power of "The exorcist." "This is a film that relentlessly attacks the senses and does not apologize for doing so. The gender entries that followed him had no choice but to follow his example because without help he redefined what the audience understood as cinematic horror. While Linda Blair deserves a lot of attention for her excellent work, the equally powerful performance of Jason Miller as Father Karras should not be overlooked. It gives the film an important human component that holds it firmly. Without the Karras bow, `` The Exorcist \'\' is just another screaming movie trying to make money by resorting to cheap emotions. Truly innovative, `` The exorcist \'\' is an impressive work that dared to test the limits of cinema. No serious discussion about the great cinema is complete without mentioning it.'

Please, can anyone find out if Warner Brothers or whoever produces them is going to complete the series of final editions? In other words, do you create and sell the latest editions of Deathly Hallows ONE and TWO without the badges, pins and other `` doo-dad \'\' that adult fans are not interested in getting at all? b'This 90-minute DVD of PBS is somewhat misnamed, but it\'s still an entertaining and fine show. The WCTE WCTE station in Cookeville, TN recorded a series of concerts at the `` Hall of the Volcano \'\' at Cumberland Caverns, 333 feet below ground level. The DVD includes fragments of the performances of 10 musicians or bands that are better called "Americana". Some are what can best be described as `` bluegrass \'\', including the well-known Ricky Skaggs and the Cherryholmes family group. Singer and songwriter Darrell Scott and Steve Earle\'s son, Justin Townes Earle (both of whom I love) are better classified as "American". The young band 18 South mixes country and bluegrass, while Will Hoge is closer to rock than anything else. Based on the age of both their appearance and the song they play, I suppose that, although this DVD is dated in 2011, the JT Earle clip was recorded about four years ago. I could not identify the others. The performances were recorded with a live audience and it is somewhat ordered to see the rocks of the Caverns in the background, but since the musicians are so well reproduced, I\'m not sure what makes the sound better or different. There are no real introductions; the performer is identified by a title on the screen. So there is no padding here. I enjoyed seeing artists that I know and love (if you have not seen the whitest Black Gospel singer in history, Mike Farris, this is your chance!) But I also discovered some new ones. On the one hand, I would like to see a follow-up of this DVD. I hope you find this review informative and useful. Steve Ramm \'\' Anything Phonographic \'\''

b"There are those who criticize JFK, alleging that Oliver Stone did not take the facts into account and rewrote the story. True or not, this completely ignores the point. Stone himself said that his intention in making the film was to make his audience question authority and think for himself. The film is presented as a POSSIBLE explanation (a combination of two separate theories) for the unusual events that led to the Kennedy assassination, and actually raises more questions than it answers. The cast is phenomenal. The award-winning cinematography and editing are pioneering, to say the least. Despite his opinion on JFK policy, the film is one of the few that I dare say is perfect. It's the reason why I'm a filmmaker, and it's worth every second you spend watching it. Never forget."

b'First of all, I want to inform you that I am a great recreational fan. So this comes from the perspective of a fanatic. Do you really want to know what this is? This is like the DVD "Miracle On Third Street", where the real stories are kept together. There are 4 real stories (3 episodes of TV already seen) and only one new episode of 13 minutes. It begins when TJ and his gang return to the old abandoned yard at the back of the playground and are captured by the kindergarten children. They are held as "hostages" by the new boss called Chief Stinky and the gang tries to tell them stories about their experiences with the kindergarteners and then Gus tells them when the gang were kindergarten children (the new episode). The three episodes already seen are `` The Legend of Big Kid \'\', `` Wild Child \'\', and `` The Kindergarten Derby. \'\' Bonus DVD episodes titled \'\' Fans\' 3 Favorite Episodes\' \'are: The Challenge, The Story of Whomps, and One Stayed Clean. * I doubt they are the most favorite because I know that `` The Experiment \'\' is very popular among fans because it is when TJ and Spinelli kiss for the first time. Also if you wonder why Gus is on the cover when he allegedly entered Third Street in 4th grade. Well, on the DVD, Gus went to Third Street during Kindergarten but only for a couple of weeks and only he remembers kindergarten while the rest of the gang does not remember anything about that year which explains why Gus is on the cover. I\'ll notice that the voices of TJ and Mikey are different (not too different or annoying, but it\'s notorious) because the original voices of the voice actors had become too deep. Anyway, when I bought this DVD, I thought it would be an hour-long adventure when TJ and the gang were kindergarteners ... but unfortunately that was not the case. It was really pathetic for Disney to do that and give a sloppy patch of episodes `` already seen on TV. \'\' I gave him only 2 stars for the new episode. If you bought `` Miracle on Third Street \'\' and you were disappointed, I do not think you want this. If you are a new fan and you have not seen all the episodes ... then this is a great DVD for you to catch up! If you are a parent and consider this as a simple whimsical entertainment for your child, I would HIGHLY suggest it, but more so because the DVD and the episodes are hilarious, but they can also have good and affectionate messages of friendship and belief in oneself, and so on I know that most children like this because my younger cousins \xe2\x80\x8b\xe2\x80\x8b(between 8 and 12 years old) also like caricature and can relate to the characters when they are in school. I hope this helps the kids!'

b"The stories of Dumas have been filmed so often, however, it is still a pleasure to watch them. This new version of the Count of Monte Cristo is no exception. It has serious flaws and errors, too numerous to list. For example: modern language lines, totally incredible interpretations (as other critics mentioned), very amateur characterizations (the Count twirls his locks and his old love recognizes him by the gesture instead of by its almost unaltered appearance). None of these things really upset me. I sat and enjoyed. The opening scene created a mood and photography in general showed fine adjustments. The ending was incredibly cheesy, but since I just saw a wonderful fight / fencing scene with a lush green environment, I did not care too much. A strong complaint that I have about most new movies: the voices are almost inaudible compared to the background of music and noise. I hope you read the book, if you have not done it yet. No film has made the story of Dumas telling the power to justice. The film version of The Three Musketeers with Michael York as D'Artagnan was close. If you are willing to entertain yourself, this movie can adapt to your mood. I already saw it three times."

b'Breakdown is a terrifying movie that enters into the most timely fears of our time, joyfully and perhaps sardonically represents what happens when we discover that our $ 50,000 sport utility vehicle is not enough to protect us from all the nasty unpleasant people who are out there in the world waiting to give a big blow to the face. Kurt Russell is Jeff Taylor and his wife, Amy (Kathleen Quinlan), have been rooted in Massachusetts to move around the country through the driving method. After talking to a redneck truck driver because his Jeep breaks down in the Utah desert, frightening fun begins. As in Spielberg\'s Duel, the evil comes like a big truck. The truck driver named Red (JT Walsh) agrees to take Amy to the nearest public phone while Jeff stays with the car. Now, it\'s easy to wonder why in the world Jeff would let his wife go with a total stranger. in an 18-wheeler, but put yourself in the same situation and you would probably do the same. One goes for help, the other keeps the car. Amy disappears, never appears in Belle\'s Diner, where she was supposed to meet Jeff. Clients have never seen it. And when Jeff chases Red\'s platform, Amy is nowhere to be found. Worse yet, Red claims that he had never seen Jeff in his life before. What happens now is: "let\'s find the wife". "What an exciting ride that the entire cast gives, especially Russell as the nervous one, ready to enter the dumb husband who allowed his wife to release her loving hand on that lonely road when a nice trucker said,` `Come with me, I can help you "Russell has an amazing performance as the obsessed husband who allowed his wife to escape. He becomes totally focused, almost obsessively, so to discover why this city has never seen his wife, the lips are closed and you definitely have the opinion that it is Creepville, Utah. Run. What a fun ride. You will have sweaty palms everywhere.'

b"Robocop 2 is probably the most underestimated and most harshly criticized sequel in history (tying with Predator 2, which came out the same year). Due to a few missing elements of the first and a slightly more caricatural approach to violence, both the critics and the public were not happy and the opinions and feelings towards the franchise plummeted with the horrible Robocop 3. Do not get confused. of a good movie though. Robocop 2 still has the same wild sense of humor, cynical social commentary and pathos character of the first film. It is a hyperrealistic vision of an America populated by gun-loving psychopaths, a democracy owned by big business and addicted to poverty addicted to drugs offered by street vendors who believe they are the second coming of Christ. be the typical way to describe it. Completely over the top would be more appropriate. The director of Empire Strikes Back, Irvin Kershner, throws so much sadistic violence, deafening shots, endless destruction and loss of human life that the film simply begs you not to take it seriously. Some blamed writer Frank Miller for making the film more Caricature than the original. I do not think this is very fair. I read Miller's original script when I was in high school and it's quite different and, dare I say, you can not film. Robocop 2 himself was not Nuke Lord Caine, the psychotic hippie with Godhood delusions. His name was Kong, a psychotic policeman who practically killed everyone he crossed. Sgt. Reed and the old man died and there was not much humor. The screenwriter Walon Green was hired to brown the script and much of what appears on the screen is actually his work. The original ideas of Frank Miller were left practically as the framework for the whole film and part of its history was recycled in Robocop 3 (do not blame him for that either). Miller obviously was upset with this, but it was still a good enough sport to appear in the movie (watch him playing Doctor Frank), although he swore never to work in Hollywood again for fear of being taken advantage of. Until Robert Rodriguez promised to fulfill his graphic novel of Sin City. It is possible that Irhoven is gone, but Irvin Kershner strives to offer the same mixture of joy and magic, and actually does it well. The melancholic score of Basil Poledouris is also gone (he returns in Robocop 3) but the new composer Leonard Rosenman creates a wonderfully heroic and optimistic theme that adapts more to the film than the temperamental and tormented Poledouris score to the first. Filmed once again in Texas, Houston this time, you really have to feel for Peter Weller walking in that Robosuit. It must have weighed a ton and it would be sweating inside loads of cubes. There is a particular scene in the movie where Murphy is tortured to death / destruction which is very hard to see. But that leads him to get a completely new makeover and those crazy new directives got in his head. The part where he teaches the children of the Little League and scolds young people who play by the fire hydrant with leaks (after citing some very suspicious philosophy) is funny. Robocop 2 is a great movie. Despite the problems with the script and the history and some slightly outdated stop-motion effects, it's a brilliant sequel that lives up to expectations. Listen to those who do not say. I do not know what kind of movie they expected. And thanks for not smoking! The DVD is wide screen anamorphic 1.85: 1 with dazzling colors (look at the chrome of the armor of Robo) and Dolby 5.1 sound. I'm a little sad that there are no extras, like a comment, because I really would have liked to hear what Kershner has to say about the movie. And there are deleted scenes that I know make Murphy visit his grave and some more details about why Caine is so weird. All right. One can only hope for that in the future ..."
b'Do not be seduced by the first two reviews that Amazon has published on this page. This DVD is the authorized release and the quality is fantastic.'

b'This 30th anniversary edition features the original movie Night of the Living Dead and offers a new soundtrack and new scenes. As far as I\'m concerned, the original film was perfect and it was not necessary, however, I decided to have an open mind and give this edition a try, considering that the new material was written by John Russo (who co-wrote the original film), and has a photograph (and performance) of Hinzman (who also helped create the original). I was completely disappointed. The new scenes include a new presentation, miscellaneous scenes of zombies marching and being killed by southern peasants, and a new epilogue. The miscellaneous scenes sometimes interfere with the flow of the film, the makeup is less effective and some of the new extras are terrible. They do a decent job of editing in the new scenes, but they are still noticeable (for example, fashions are not entirely correct). The new introduction and the epilogue are ridiculous. The introduction simply states that the main zombie (played by Hinzman) was a criminal when he was alive. This moves away from one of the most effective elements of the film: that the zombies could be their neighbor next door or a friend or close relative, but they will try to kill him without thinking. Hinzman is obviously older in the frontal shots (the profiles are fine). When he starts attacking two gravediggers, one of the "actors" begins to flee, then realizes that Hinzman was supposed to grab him first, so he actually goes back to the coffin and bends so that Hinzman can grab him! ! ! The fact that they did not take a second shot shows a lack of attention. The epilogue is a "one year later" interview with an insane preacher of the fire of hell and brimstone who survived the carnage. It is stuck in the middle (spoiler warning) of the scene of the death of Duane Jones and the final credits that show the rednecks that get rid of their body. ! Talk about interfering with a very effective ending! You have the option to see the original cut (in an excellent impression), but you can only see it with the new soundtrack! The old soundtrack was composed of music from the library, but it worked excellently. In the best of cases, the new soundtrack is mediocre. Sometimes it does not even adjust to the atmosphere of the scene, for example, being frantic when the action is more calm and depressing. The booklet contains interviews mostly consisting of actors who talk about how "no flaws" the new scenes were added and how many fans will love the new version (bad). There is a funny comment track, but you get the same people (plus others, including Romero) giving the same information on the comment tracks in the very superior Elite Millennium Edition.'

b"I so badly wanted to enjoy this movie. I hoped that somehow I would 'pick up' and stand up. Unfortunately he never did, and in fact only gave way to a strange nothing somewhere in the middle. It could have been deeper, the plot more involved. The characters could have been much more than they were. This movie is a jumble of nebulous loose ends that are never tied. b'I was very disappointed with how far this film deviates from the real story! He is "approximately" Prince Caspian, but he lacks many important elements. Number one, they left Aslan almost in its entirety until the end. Those who are familiar with the book will remember that Aslan is the most important part of the strength and development of the story. It was he who called the children to Narnia for his purpose a plan. Half of the book is about Aslan and the children, so the fact that they have left their importance outside of the movie really ruins the story. Not Aslan, not Narnia! There are a number of other aspects that do not fit the book, but some of these could be more easily overlooked if they had not deviated from the true "Heart" of the story. The other big disappointment for me was how he altered the character of Peter. His whole attitude changed. You never have the chance to warm up to him and, in the end, he\'s almost glad he does not return to Narnia. (The same can be said of Susan.) The storyline seemed very weak, and the relationship that Caspian and Susan tried to create was totally unnecessary and I felt it helped a lot to ruin the movie as well. But if you are not interested in the fidelity of the story, the "Prince Caspian" by Andrew Adamson is an action-packed adventure with many wonderful visual and special effects. However, I recommend that you read the story. The book has much more wealth and purpose. I wish they had stayed true to this story, just as they had the `` The Lion the Witch and the Wardrobe. \'\' I hope you do better in `` The Voyage of the Dawn Treader \'\'. We will see ... ! These are just some of my thoughts. Needless to say, I feel that they could have made this movie so much better.'

b'This documentary is complete BS. The facts and opinions are totally incorrect. I doubt whoever is responsible for this has even read a single book in Gettysburg. Heth\'s troops opened the battle, not Early. Little Roundtop was the most important battle feature on the second day, not on Culp Hill. Custer did not `` Save the Union. \'\' In fact, Grant\'s victory at Vicksburg did more to end the Civil War than the Battle of Gettysburg. If Meade had lost there, he would have retreated to Washington\'s impenetrable defenses and waited for Grant\'s army to move Lee away from the district. I have read in many books about Gettysburg that Lincoln was furious that Meade did not follow the battle. chasing Lee. His statements about a "discovery" of a handwritten telegram about this and subsequent opinions was absurd. In fact, these four "facts" are only the beginning. Even the material related to the direction was silly. Avoid this garbage.'

b"This is one of those rare movies that completely captures teenagers in a fun and honest way. Enid and Rebecca are two misfits who have just graduated from high school. While Rebecca gets a job trying to get her own apartment and move into adulthood, Enid is still struggling to try to find her place in a new world. This is obvious from his reluctance to get a job and move on. After making a joke to an older and lonely man, somehow ends up becoming his friend while separating from Rebecca. Enid is a character with whom sometimes you get angry, but at the same time you understand that you are having trouble moving forward in life and feeling empathy for. He is very talented but has no idea what exactly he wants to do. So he resorts to the marginalized, like the crazy old man waiting for a bus that never arrives and old Seymour. This movie is often sad but also fun. You always wonder where this movie will take you. Even the end is the perfect touch, although some do not like it. It's a great movie that is really real and honest. These are not characters from cardboard cutouts, these are real girls. In conclusion, all the rumor deserves. You will like this if you enjoy intelligent and independent films that are not invented and that actually have some real meaning. Sparkly!"

b'Interview with a vampire was an excellent movie, made wonderfully based on an incredible idea. Queen Of The Damned illustrates, though nothing else, that Anne Rice is a wonderfully creative writer, but I discovered that this film version of one of her books was very boring with many fine characters like wafers. The vampire Lestat (wonderfully played by Stuart Townsend) decides to leave retirement, which in fact is a dream of several hundred years. He gives a great idea of \xe2\x80\x8b\xe2\x80\x8bthe world of vampires; you know that he hates light, garlic and all the holy things; loves the darkness, attractive blood, young lady necks and eerrr `` Nu-Metal! "But what bothers him most is that he is immortal." I mean he does not age at all, he seems to have unlimited financial resources, however, he is so bored with life. It sounds like a kind of spoiled, spoiled vampire to me! So he realizes that if he can provoke all the other vampires, maybe they will be so enraged that they will get him out of this eternal misery, and who better for the job than the `` Queen of the Damned \'\' - or Aaliyah for us . How do you provoke them and her? Well, he becomes the lead singer of the biggest and most controversial Nu-Metal band in the world. Hi, I would definitely be with all the other vampires. There are interesting aspects to this movie: how he became a vampire and how he dealt with this is quite fascinating. In addition, it is all fused with typical Gothic colors and images. The monologue of his thoughts is full of comical irony and is presented in a wonderful form of \'dead story\'. Some of the subtle interactions between the characters are also hilarious. Aaliyah looks amazing in her role as the queen of all vampires; she really has a presence on the screen and what a tragedy that her career as an actress and musician was interrupted. The conflicts between vampires and vampires that go through the film are also quite original. Unfortunately, none of the effects is particularly spectacular. In general, although the idea is good, the development and the story are too weak for this to be a truly memorable film.'

b"The war against humanity is at its highest point. The planet Roku San is at its hardest point. With military support dwindling, soldiers dying daily and with new insects constantly being revealed to the world, how will humanity survive, if it were not you? The Federation is currently looking for men and women to help fight this terror. How would you like to be a hero and how would you like to become a citizen while you do it? Would you like to know more ? STARSHOOP TROOPERS as a series has become famous, if only because the second movie did not contribute anything to the story of the first film. With little hope in mind, I started looking at STARSHOOP TROOPERS: MARAUDER with the hope that, somehow, it would be better than the second, and maybe as good as the first. Suddenly, disillusionment takes the reins and returns me one step with STARSHIP TROOPERS 3. Located on the planet Roku San and following our original hero, Johnny Rico, it soon shows that the movie has little hope when we know some of his characters. Johnny Rico, experienced in his newfound years in the military, has always been known not to follow orders, but in the case of death? Marshal of Heaven, one of the most famous men on Earth, is he a pop star? And soldiers who would not normally be impressed by the star are in love with the presence of a field marshal singer, often to the point of completely disobeying orders and ignoring the outside threat. What does the series have, too, if it's not a total cheese factor? Unfortunately, this does not go away soon. With a plot that follows mainly a carefree actress, called Angelina Jolie, called Jolene Blalock while leading a small group of people in the desert of Roku San, the film finally goes down as it becomes an exaggerated attempt of a science film fiction. PROS: - Some actors. Jolene Blalock played her character very well, as did Marnette Patterson as Holly Little. I also have to give credit to the man who played Johnny Rico for his contribution to this film. I do not know how much they paid him, but with the hope of justifying his time by playing in a very bad and very underdeveloped movie. The long list of cons: CONS: The CGI. Since the first film was made in 1997, it was incredibly disappointing that the CGI was so bad. Given the advancement in computer graphics technology, one would think that a movie would at least TRY to meet standards like its 1997 counterpart. No, it did not. There is no need to think more. The acting. Most of the action was full of poor actors and actresses. Over emphasized, without emphasis, without emphasis at all, I found very few actors worth watching. I could not help being ashamed of the way some of them played their characters, and the way several of them were portrayed. Military men and women do not follow what we, as individuals, would think they would do, marshals and officers order the troops in senseless and senseless patterns, and the soldiers throw themselves on explosive insects when they can simply retreat to the back of the room . Courage is not even a problem here, its stupidity takes the toll. The cheese. Yes, I specifically mentioned cheese, if only because it is very relevant in this film. Sky Marshals as pop stars, the soldiers tell them that they will shoot them if they ask for an autograph, then they try to ask for an autograph, high-ranking Federation officials do not bother to draw a gun when they are beaten mercilessly, and then they try to Arrest a soldier for having taken him out of the assailant, there is not a cheesy amount of action in this movie, since there is no shortage of stupidity that comes with the cheese factor. In general, I could not help it. I wonder what exactly happened with this movie. STARSHIP TROOPERS 2 was a disappointment in itself, but three? ... it is awful . It's better than 2, if only because it follows the history and world construction of the first best, but it still does not make it a movie worth seeing. The STARSHIP TROOPERS franchise should have died after the first one was made. . MARAUDER should quickly die a slow and horrible death, if only because it tarnishes the original to the point of disappointment. I was excited to see this, despite the warnings that several of my friends gave me. I definitely will not see a room in this movie. If I start trying, I'll remind myself how horrible two and three were, and then I'll insert the first movie in the DVD player, if only because the first will always be the only good STARSHIP TROOPERS movie."

b'This is one of my favorite movies, a great movie in which Welles showed the world that he could make a classic Hollywood movie without exceeding the budget and continue to produce a genuine and personal masterpiece. b'Coleman Silk (Anthony Hopkins) is a highly respected dean and university professor. After an innocent comment is misinterpreted as a racist comment, he is forced to give up his work in disgrace. Coleman begins a strange adventure with a woman without direction (Nicole Kidman) of half her age, who has had a tragic past and is not ready to return his love. For me, this strange little film was doomed from the beginning, when the great finish is shown immediately. The rest of the story is shown in choppy and anticlimactic flashbacks (often out of order) that did not allow any buildup of tension or sympathy for the main character, Coleman. As a young man from New Jersey, he is played by Wentworth Miller, who is quite charismatic and pleasant, but he looked and looked nothing like the adult Welsh Coleman (who sometimes seemed to channel Hannibal Lector). Hopkins is so terribly wrong in this role that it is impossible to buy the racially charged plot. Kidman was also completely wrong in this movie; Her innate grace and elegance could not be hidden by a messy hairstyle and I never bought her as an illiterate custodian. His graphic love scenes with Hopkins were more spooky than romantic. There is so much personal tragedy among the main characters, including Gary Sinise who plays a writer with problems and Ed Harris as a Vietnam veteran, and yet the film fails completely and I did not feel anything connected with them or the whole premise of injustice. Afterwards, I kept shaking my head at this amazing disaster of a movie and I was amazed that so much talent could not save it.'

b'& quot; Coffy & quot; (1973) made Pam Grier a star, & quot; Foxy Brown & quot; (1974) clearly shows why Grier became a star. & quot; Foxy Brown & quot; simply distills the star qualities of Grier and uses them to their full potential, and stellar qualities, I do not mean just his broad chest. In & quot; Foxy Brown & quot; Grier is a crazy mistreated and raped in search of revenge at all costs, not only chews the landscape, but erases it. But that\'s exactly why we love Grier. She is beautiful, sensual and can kick an ass completely! As far as I\'m concerned, she\'s the original action heroine on the screen and this vehicle best shows her talent as an action star. Unlike & quot; Coffy, & quot; & quot; Foxy Brown & quot; does not give Grier much opportunity to flex his acting muscles, but presents Grier down and dirty: Foxy loots apartments, hits hostile lesbians, hits eyes, burns living men, emasculates (literally and figuratively) and even pulls out guns of your perfectly groomed afro & quot; Foxy Brown & quot; It is creepy, tremendously sadistic, absolutely exaggerated and a classic cult movie for those same reasons. & quot; Coffy & quot; It may be the best movie, but & quot; Foxy Brown & quot; It\'s nicer. So, how? Foxy Brown & quot; rate on DVD? Well, the album is an absolute revelation. Since the theatrical debut of the movie it did not look so good. The previous full-frame transfer used for the video cassette and the laser disk was atrocious, with yellowish skin tones, excessively saturated colors, dark turbid interiors, ruined compositions and horribly oversized edges. The new anamorphically enhanced widescreen transfer is bright. The compositions are properly preserved with an aspect ratio of 1.85: 1, there is no more distracting free space and a bit of image information is added to the sides. The interiors now reveal wood panels, earth tone wallpaper and brown curtains, unlike the previous transfer that represents almost all black or dark brown. The skin tones are finally natural and the colors of the film are reduced to a level of saturation understandable, but do not worry, the fashions of the 70s are still a brilliant kaleidoscope of mud. The sharpness is pleasant; the edge enhancement never raises its ugly head and the skies of the film are finally blue. It was sunlight and yellow sunlight. The film grain is noticed in some dark scenes and there are some defects of origin. Considering that this is a low budget exploitation film made in 1974, the source element is almost pristine. The compression on the disk is not as pristine, however. Some dark, shadowy and dissolved areas are often subject to mosaic artifacts, but at a retail price of only $ 14.95, who can file a complaint? Supplements include the fun theatrical trailer ("Foxy has guts: there\'s nothing, ands or buts!") And an illuminating comment track by director Jack Hill who repeatedly describes the work of working with AIP (American International Pictures) in this movie, which according to him was one of his worst cinematic experiences. The monaural sound on the disc is commendable; the dialogue is always intelligible and the bass level makes the Willie Hutch score sound as funky as it was 27 years ago. Jack Hill created Pam Grier his own subgenre with & quot; Coffy & quot; and & quot; Foxy Brown & quot; and when she left it after "gloomy" & quot; Friday Foster, & quot; nobody took his place ... no one could do it. & quot; Foxy Brown & quot; is the ultimate Pam Grier action vehicle, a blaxploitation classic and a great DVD! If you\'ve only seen & quot; Foxy Brown & quot; in videocassette or laserdisc, you have not seen & quot; Foxy & quot; absolutely .'

b"I've been a small-time follower of Smallville, and every year there are always fans (including myself) who mark the current year as `` Jumping the shark ''. If you explore my profile, you will find that my reviews of previous seasons begin with enthusiasm and become more critical as the years go by. While I will not comment on season 8 that is currently broadcasting, the trend seems to be true when comparing season 7 with the previous six: they are pure geniuses compared to this disaster. There are too many things at stake. this year. Smallville always has great comic book stories, but lacks development and internal logic within its own world. Writers jump from plot to plot without rhythm, so you get seemingly dramatic events that change lives and that are completely forgotten in the next episode. There is a surprising twist that involves the new Daily Planet Editor, which does not work well when it becomes interesting; the return of Clark's biological mother, Lara barely lasts one episode; Bizzaro appears and is quickly defeated - twice; Clark travels through time and space to save his baby in Krypton in five minutes. Sam Jones finally returns as Pete Ross and is wasted in a horrible product placement. Supergirl shows up and barely develops before she carries the clich\xc3\xa9 of amnesia and disappears for most of the season. Why not settle for 2 or 3 stories and develop them properly? And do not blame the writer's strike, which cuts this season in 2 episodes, the problems were obvious before the strike occurred. Speaking of external influences, a good number of characters leave the program this year. The sudden departure of Kristen Kreuk to film Street Fighter leaves her already weak character a somewhat anemic farewell, fortunately she will return briefly in season 8 to tie loose ends. Another character that I will not spoil dies a noble death, and will be missed. However, Rosenbaum's departure is the true kicker. Not only does Smallville's best actor not come back, but he was left with an ambiguous and unsatisfactory ending. Hardly 7 years of incredible work. There are some things that Smallville does well this year: the return of Brainiac and the story of 'Veritas' bring a sense of continuity that the program has been regrettably absent. But, in general, there is a lack of coherence that seasons 5 and 6 tried to have, and the program has no heart now that the Kent parents are gone. Whether you need this season or not depends on whether you bought the first six and absolutely want the entire collection."

b'`` L\'Affaire du Collier \'\' can be based on a true story, but it is also an exciting historical romance, `` The Queen\'s Necklace \'\', by Alexandre Dumas, who undoubtedly had more than `` The Three Musketeers \'\'. \'in the sleeve. Dumas tells the identical story of Joseph Balsamo (also known as Count Cagliostro), Jeanne de la Motte Valois, the lustful but charming Cardinal de Rohan and the great diamond scam, although the filmmakers do not give any credit to Dumas (I note that the book is available) on Amazon.com, and I recommend it!). The costume designer, Malena Canonero, deserves applause for the fringes of silks, satins and lace jabots that magnificently recreate the opulence of Louis XVI\'s 18th century court. The configuration is also splendid. However, I found that much of the music was discordant, as the composer insisted on giving it a modern rhythm at times, and also used a hodgepodge of Mozart\'s `` Requiem \'\', among other things. I find such cuts and rearrangements of a bar here; A bar there, to be lazy and a little deceiving. In the film, the director explained that he wanted the period to be "accessible" for modern audiences. Such "accessibility" not only insults the intelligence of the modern audience, but also weakens the film. Because the story is so strong, however, I enjoyed the movie. He was particularly impressed with the performances of Jonathan Pryce as the gentle cardinal, Adrien Brody as the irresponsible husband of Jeanne, and Simon Baker, who is especially interesting as his love interest. They are all believable and move well in their silks. Even though Hilary Swank is an excellent actress, I thought she was wrong in this role. She looks a little uncomfortable with her suit and moves more like a twenty-first-century woman instead of an eighteenth-century woman. Leaving aside these reservations, I will keep this film and I will definitely see it again.'
