Gigi is a great movie and one of my favorites, but I expected a better Blu-Ray quality. . My old widescreen VHS looks almost as good on the big Sony. And where is the Overture sequence?"

b'Carole Lombard was an intelligent and beautiful natural blonde, the best comedian of Screwball, the best-paid actress, the wife of Clark Gable and one of the most powerful women in Hollywood during the 1930s until her untimely death in 1942. This DVD is beautifully restored gives us an idea of \xe2\x80\x8b\xe2\x80\x8bCarole Lombard and the effect it had for the audiences of the 30s. This was his only Technicolor color film he ever made. So sit back and watch how her natural beauty and genius acts on the screen. Fredric March as his co-star joins this adorably humorous film. In Summary: A Vermont girl, Hazel Flagg (Lombard), diagnosed with radio (terminal) poisoning. A New York film Jounalist (March) reads about this in a newspaper and wants to use this event to increase the popularity of his magazines by sponsoring Hazel. Taking her to New York City and introducing the `` Keys to the City \'\' and VIP status arouses great public awareness. All the time using public sympathy to increase magazine sales. Hazel discovers that she was misdiagnosed and reluctantly continues with the scam. Meanwhile, March begins to fall in love with Hazel and he wants her to rest and be comfortable until her end. As you can see, this has a strange turn of events that is the main ingredient of the `` COMEDAS DE SCREWBALL \'\' of the 30s. Demonstrating `` Nothing is sacred \'\'! ! ! Extras include: 2 first silent Lombard movies and home movies from Gable and Lombard. This is a collectible DVD of "LIMITED EDITION".'

b"First let me say that, as a former military man, I am a great admirer of this film. I am also aware that when I write a review of something here, there are too many ad hominem attacks, and not refutations of the revision, which makes me reluctant to comment on anything. Having said that, I must admit that I am very disappointed with this Four Feathers Criterion theme. I have always thought that the Criterion DVDs are the best ones, and I thought that the blu-ray edition would be absolutely right, however, that is not the case with this one. I own an MGM edition of the film, and found that it is generally superior to that of Criterion. I do not know if I just have bad luck and I received a bad copy of the movie, but I'll send it to Amazon and I'll keep my copy of MGM. Issues to be mentioned: the Criterion edition, although more clear, has a very irregular color transfer, too bright in some places and with some discolorations in others. There are no subtitles on the Criterion DVD, but the MGM version has them, in several languages. I noticed that in several parts of the film the color faded and the backgrounds appeared washed, as if the film had been colored. As I mentioned, do not attack me personally for this review. If your copy of this movie is better than the one I wrote, then it will be good for you. I will still return the DVD to Amazon and leave it at that. This is only the opinion of a man."

b"This is the first Star Trek movie in which the people of the Next Generation are introduced. Also some of the original characters are involved. That's where it starts going downhill. They present us with the tri-lithium substance, which can kill the suns. The data finally captures the human emotions, and the two Captains are put to work side by side. However, they turn the 1701-D into a weak ship, making it explode with a single blow (not even a salvo, actually) of an obsolete ship, delapidated Klingon of prey / explorer class (as Mr. Chekov would have called it ) that had faults while in service. I realize they wanted a known set, but I should have died harder. And the death of Admiral Kirk was not enough to do him justice. It was supposed to be a transitional film, but the first generation, although it did not come out with a moan, certainly did not come out with a bang. It was more like a moan."

b"Dumbo is a classic Disney movie, which is iconic in its imagery of the pink elephants and the small, poor elephant with ears too big to fit into the society of the elephants. This is a very sad and bittersweet movie, since Dumbo is removed from his mother, who takes pride in his lost son. Dumbo has to find his own identity and find a way to not be bothered all the time. Originally released in 1941, Dumbo has a duration of only 63 minutes. The special features of the Big Top Edition far exceed the function itself. There is a game that teaches children about circus animals, a storybook, two long songs, a music video, several Disney short films. Outside the track of comments and short films, little here is of value or interest to the adult. The real problem with this new edition of '' Big Top '' is that it is not significantly different from the `` 60th Anniversary Edition ''. There is a different music video, the addition of one function and the loss of others. The quality of the film itself is not dramatically different from the previous version. Honestly, Dumbo is a Disney movie that is worth owning. But it does not matter which edition you buy. Joe Sherry"

b"It is a great waste of Travolta's talent, although it gave a good performance, the plot is very predictable, repetitive and lame. b'Originally released as a \'\' 3-D \'\' movie of the \'80s, so the opening title is so hard to read on conventional television with meteorites buzzing, Spacehunter is a well-made movie that does not "get you out of head". living room \'\'. b'Mike Leigh\'s films are improvised; almost all are interesting. They are generally beloved of the Oscars, and `` Vera Drake \'\' is no exception. I will not mention the plot, because, if you are reading this, you already know it. Imelda Staunton is, in fact, magnificent. I recently saw the movie, and last year at Oscar I thought I would win, because of the slug party that seems to involve Swank & Bening, the only times they were involved. I thought that the votes would be divided, as often happens. Imelda was kind, glorious, sweet and down to earth in this performance, a true amalgam of interpretive skill. Mike Leigh also used Brenda Blethyn to take advantage of `` Secrets & Lies \'\'. An excellent story and an interesting part of the story, this movie is wonderful, especially with respect to the other characters involved, all of which are excellent. Mr. Leigh is brilliant and uses women well; I hope he will soon get away from that improvisational tool that requires women to whine and cry. Imelda\'s whining was annoying, but, in "Secrets & Lies," Blethyn was distracting him. Still, a wonderful show of acting, and a good person with good intentions that, unfortunately, were against the law. I am pro-life, to some extent; I almost understood Vera\'s motivations, especially regarding rape. In the 1950s, frivolous behavior was not as accepted as it is now, and Vera was there to be a friend. The movie is worth watching. Its historical importance in perspective is priceless. The family was made to be so important. This is good .'

b"The websites that track the positive and negative reviews of the main critics register a positive score of at least 95% for Ratatouille, clearly putting it on top of the 2007 films. Is it the best movie of the year? No, but it is the one that has more appeal, since almost everyone will consider it a positive experience. Ratatouille follows Remy, a curious rat who aspires to be more than a garbage thief. The keen sense of smell and Remy's appreciation for food draw him to the culinary arts. By stealing what he can from an appreciation of homeowners for cooking shows and books, Remy becomes a devotee of one of France's most famous chefs, Auguste Gusteau. After Remy learns that Gusteau died years ago and that he had seen reruns of his television show, the little rat begins to be guided by Ben Kenobi with the spirit of the dead chef. Following the spirit eventually leads to the old Gusteau restaurant. which has been assumed by a naive capitalist who uses the image of Gusteau to sell frozen burritos and corndogs. By using a young kitchen worker as a medium, Remy tries to rebuild Gusteau's reputation and return his restaurant to his glory. The resulting action is an often charming story of a rat so dedicated to finding herself as achieving her goal. Many laughs are found when your family appears looking for brochures, and the main antagonists (the owner and a food critic) create real dramatic moments. Remy is really a `` hero '' movie, someone dedicated to a cause that he believes will make the world a better place. Although missing the heart of the Toy Story films or the comic brilliance of the first Shrek, Ratatouille continues the trend of the revival of animation that has provided some of the best films of the last decade."

b"Originally released for Christmas in 1935, this splendidly produced, atmospheric and superbly rendered film showed the talent of M-G-M for filming literary classics, DAVID COPPERFIELD was launched earlier that year, without haggling expenses; the assault on the Bastille sequence used several thousand extras and was filmed in one of the largest sets in Hollywood. Ronald Colman was initially reluctant to play the role of Sidney Carlton, that charming but dissolute lawyer who commits the utmost personal sacrifice ... ... It was necessary to persuade Colman to shave the characteristic mustache for the role of Carlton, but he he more than likely gave his best performance (Later in his life, Colman admitted that this was his personal favorite of all his roles). Charles Dicken's classic poignant portrait of Paris and London of the seventeenth century and the events surrounding the French Revolution had been filmed as silent on four different occasions - three times in Britain and the United States - this remains the definitive masterpiece. Under the meticulous direction of Jack Conway, A TALE OF TWO CITIES offers memorable performances by an excellent cast, including the wonderfully hungry Blanche Yurka, the terrifying Lucille LaVerne, Edna May Oliver Vinegar, the despicable Basil Rathbone, the eloquent Henry B. Walthall ( it was the `` Little Colonel '' in BIRTH OF A NATION) and, in a radical change of pace, the somber Isabel Jewell, as the pathetic seamstress who accompanies Colman to the place of his execution."

b'What can I say about this uninspired "recount" of Bret\'s first novel? The film adaptation does not contain the scenes and the tone that I thought made the book so disturbing and memorable. (The dead child in the alley scene, the snuff film with the underage girl ...) This movie really can not be said to be based on the book, it is more because it is inspired by the novel. Despite this fall, the film is worth it for any admirer of Bret Easton Ellis, if only to satisfy curiosity. The film does not contain either the perfectly depressing verses or the deliciously disturbing minor characters that make the book so interesting and attractive (Clay\'s sisters, Spin) The film made it seem that Julian was the protagonist, while I always thought the novel it consisted of seeing the events through Clay\'s eyes. One of the most endearing parts of the novel are Clay\'s "flashbacks" of a better moment, before going to school. The movie only touches this at the beginning, and the flashback is about Blair, not about his parents, who were the subjects of the flashbacks that I found most interesting. The lunch scene between Clay and his father is pure genius. The detachment between father and son made me tremble physically. This scene is not included at all in the movie. The unfortunate thing about adapting the films in the books is that almost always something is lost in the "translation". \'American Psycho\' is really the only one of the films adapted from his books that I feel captures the tone of the book while simultaneously compacting it into a narrative that can be seen without losing Bret\'s style, and this is due to the fact that Bateman himself is the narrator. Everything and everything, \'Less Than Zero\' is not a bad movie, really. Only a bad adaptation. Capture what was amazing and forgettable from the popular movie of the 80s, and fits any entertaining youth drama of that era (including the extravagant use of cocaine by minors, too New Wave, the star of Where Are They Now? James Spader). There are some poignant moments, but it seems as if the film tried to find a conclusion that the book did not have (and had a reason not to do so). After all, Julian does not die in the novel, and Blair certainly does not return to Camden with Clay (Morrissey would not be proud). How melancholy is the novel? also alludes: how upset, apathetic and lost Clay is now that he has changed and acquired a new perspective, while his friends, unfortunately, no. And one serious complaint: where is the Disappear Here billboard? It is an integral part of the images of the novel, and is absent in the film (unless I missed it). All and all: If you are a fan of Bret\'s books, give this film a chance. It\'s worth seeing once, but do not worry if you\'re just trying to capture the mood or purpose of the novel.'

Mayer [MGM]. She appeared in a series of B-grade movies [maybe C], often uncredited. I still carry a torch for her. In truth, she would be as old as my grandmother. b'When I came across Across the Universe, it seemed a little esoteric, even with the musical pedigree of the Beatles. The power of the songs comes alive at all times. Unconsciously imagined with a beautiful direction of art and cinematography, Across the Universe skillfully interweaves the Beatles in the socio-political context of the times in which the songs were written. Congratulations to the director Julie Taymor and the team, who clearly thought very well, and the excellent cast, who sing better than anyone would expect. This is quite a feat, considering that it could have gone wrong or done wrong. Actor Sturgess reminds me of a young Paul McCartney, but that\'s where the resemblance to anything from the Beatles ends. It\'s a pity that Across the Universe has not been successful in theaters, but I suspect the treatment may have been too smart. for today\'s audiences. It\'s a movie that comes from the heart that every Beatles fan should watch and the curious music see.'

b'First, I want to thank all the reviewers here. It is his reviews of this fine film that tempted me to buy it (that, and the fact that the director also did `` Breaker Morant \'\' - one of my favorites). I am a great admirer of this genre. I loved `` Dances with Wolves \'\' and `` Jeremiah Johnson \'\', and I really enjoyed `` The Last of the Mohicans \'\' and `` Last of the Dogmen \'\', however, none of these excellent films compares to the absolute realism represented in "Black Robe". This is a simple story set in the early seventeenth century ... a story of a French Jesuit priest who has been accused by his superiors of going canoeing to a Huron post 1,500 miles away (with the help of Indian explorers and a interpreter) and helps convert the Huron Indians to Christianity, thus saving their souls. In this film, the protagonist is not a superhero who does not make mistakes, shows no weaknesses, can shoot and go out with any man alive. On the contrary, he is just a young priest full of self-righteousness, ignorance, fear and doubt. But despite this (or because of this), his courage is truly incomparable. This is a story of real people who fight for their lives every day against the awesome hardness of nature and against other Indian tribes. This is also a story about the clash between two very varied cultures. This is shown with a mysterious subtlety, but the effects are devastating. `` Black Robe \'\' goes where few movies have gone before, or since. It\'s a film worthy of an Oscar like any I\'ve seen. The cinematography is grim, cold and implacable, as is the story. Between 1 and 10, I give this emblematic movie a solid 9. It really is one of my favorites.'

b'Lewis Gilbert\'s 1983 masterpiece, a sensitive and emotionally satisfying adaptation of Willy Russel\'s clever and insightful two-character work. Gilbert and Russel would join again for the wonderful & quot; Shirley Valentine, & quot; but his work in this movie is unparalleled. Michael Caine offers one of the most memorable performances in an illustrious career, disappearing in his character Frank, and Julie Walters is magnificent as Rita / Susan. The music of David Hentschel is perfectly appropriate, Frank Watts\' cinematography is inspired, the script is moving and honest, but the magic of this film is in the interaction between the two main characters. This film captures the path to self-awareness embodied in education, as Rita / Susan\'s character develops from hairdresser to student, intellectual, diligent and finally to someone very different at the beginning of the film, but undeniable and still unique ". Rita. & Quot; The greatest gift that a person can give to another person is the love of learning, and that is why I believe that this is one of the best love stories that has been devoted to celluloid. as inevitable as tragedy, & quot; in the words of Willy Russel, but the relationship between Frank and Rita made his emotional journey worthwhile, and we are all richer for his journey.'

b"If Daniel Barenboim is not the best living classical musician in the world, he is certainly the most versatile. In a career spanning more than 50 years, his name is attributed to many of the famous recordings of opera, symphony, small ensemble and solo piano. With the later half of his career marked by distinction on the podium, one can forget that he is still a concert pianist. Here we have both talents while Barenboim conducts the Staatskapelle Berlin and plays the five piano concertos of Beethoven. From the attached brochure we find that Barenboim first recorded these works in 1967 at the age of 24 under Otto Klemperer. Now he revisits them 40 years later on the occasion of his 65th birthday. The challenges of serving as conductor and soloist are undoubtedly considerable, but Barenboim, acting entirely by memory and without score, makes it seem simple and natural. Even while fully committed to his role as a soloist, Barenboim never loses control of the orchestra. Sometimes his direction is in the momentary freedom of a sweeping gesture of his left hand. At other times, it is the subtlety of his assent or the swiftness of his eye. The Staatskapelle is perfectly adapted to these nuances and its interpretation is always chord and never faltering. Among the many highlights: the wonderful exchange between piano and clarinet in the Largo of the first concert, an exciting narrative of the Rondo Vivace in the final movement of the fourth and all the beauty and majesty of the Emperor. The performance was recorded before a live audience during a three-day piano festival in Bochum, Germany in 2007. The concerts took place at the Jahrhunderthalle, which presents an architectural design of a converted steel factory. The minimalist interior with high ceilings and exposed steel beams gives up the traditional elegance that adorns many concert halls (and the suffocating pretension that accompanies it). Aesthetically, the Jahrhunderthalle stands out as a place that emphasizes the comfort and cleanliness of the lines of vision above all else. The exhausted public thanks and respects the music. They are often in view, but they are rarely heard (even between movements) until their applause at the end of each job. They are elegantly dressed people (if not formally) who know good classical music when they listen to it. Some of the performances took place during the day allowing the large rear windows to project a magnificent natural light on the public and the performers more illuminated by the soft lighting of the stage that highlights the musicians and their instruments where necessary and without hard shadows. The 1080i Blu-ray image is almost perfect. The skin tones are natural and attractive. The color of the instruments and the attire of the audience is precise without bleeding. The ivory keyboard is correctly exposed and balanced with a lot of resolution to see the distinction between the keys. The black levels are strong without losing any detail in the folds of the musicians jacket. The close-ups reveal the polished brass of the French horns, as well as the fine grain on the basses and violins. Barenboim is appropriately the center of attention and we can see the delicate scrolls of her hair and the beads of sweat that begin to shine on her forehead for the third movement of each concert. The PCM 2.0 audio track is clean, but the piano sounds slightly loud above the high C. On the contrary, the DTS HD-MA 5.1 track, when opening the environment of the rear channels and a wider sound stage, It offers a beautiful, warm and spacious sound, and without any discordance in the upper register. The piano is correctly centered while the sonic integrity of each orchestral instrument is presented with distinction according to its location on the stage. The full program runs at approximately 3:20. There are no supplements except for a handful of trailers from other Medici Arts releases. An interview with Barenboim, some rehearsal images and a brief history of the place would have been nice, but unfortunately missed opportunities. In the end, that's the only thing missing since it is, in any other way, a very welcome release and another great achievement for one of the most distinguished artists of classical music."

b"I will admit that I have never seen Mario Bava movies. I recently entered the Italian cinema with the films of Dario Argento and other Giallo in my interest. Until now, I had never tried any Bava. So when I listened to this movie and was intrigued with the premise, I picked up the DVD. The premise of the film is that four criminals steal the payroll of pharmaceutical companies during which the driver of the escape is killed. The three remaining assassins flee to a parking lot taking hostages, one of which they kill to escape. Then, in order not to be discovered by the police in a family car, they retire and take more hostages, this time a middle-aged man and a sick child. At this point, the movies have been a film of violent crimes. When he gets in the car, the film focuses basically on the handling of the criminals and their hostages. What is good in the film despite minor flaws is that even in its form (neither Rabid Dogs nor the Kidnapped Reissue was completed with Bava's support due to circumstances that gained their status as 'lost' until recently) It's really good thriller of suspense mounted building your tension slowly. As tensions rise in the car and victims advocate for their lives, even criminals begin to turn on each other. One wants to rape the woman as a hostage, while another follows what happens while the leader is more concerned about reaching his destination. There are moments in the film that were great for me in a transgressive way that newer movies could not even reach. And in the end, I do not want to ruin it, but if you get into the plot as much as I do, it will definitely surprise you. I was totally impressed by the movie. One thing is also the sense of anger that filters from each frame. This is a brutal movie to watch sometimes with his portrayal of a world that is vain and arrogant and quite brutal when considering the plight of the hostages (especially the child). For me it is a film that could almost compare with one of my favorites, Kurosawa's Ran. Unfortunately, I've only seen the cut of Rabid Dogs on the new Anchor Bay album. It also contains the edition of Lamberto Bava hijacked more in line with the intentions of his father, which I will see in the future, but it went out for the synthesizer's score (I love the harpsichord and the blaring organs in Rabid Dogs, although it's true that the score is incessant) and did not want to see the movie so soon after seeing it. This is still a definite recommendation from me, it's worth seeing."

b'As many critics have expressed, this is definitely a happy, irresistibly funny and simply wonderful movie to watch. In any case, it seemed to me that the plot was much more attractive and intelligent than its standard Hollywood movies. Instead of Sugiyama falling in love with the original girl who attracted him to the ballroom, he discovers the sheer joy of dancing and his liberating power that brought him closer to his family by encouraging him to show his affection and love more openly. directly. There are no clich\xc3\xa9s or well-worn plots, just a beautiful story.'

b'While it is true that the once brilliant `` Soap \'\' suffers from large terminal problems of creativity in its fourth and final season (why is Burt suddenly the healthiest member of the family?), Today it practically exceeds all comedies in the air. his daring mix of comedy, drama, romance, suspense and pathos. The fourth season offers many memorable television moments, if less than the previous three seasons, including Burt\'s crisis of faith, El Puerco and his son\'s hilarious introduction to the family, Chester\'s moving and far too late realization that he loves Jessica, Dutch and the tacky wedding of Eunice, and Mary\'s struggle to maintain her sanity in the midst of true madness. Today, even the "Soap" is not even close to this one, its weakest season. What Sony has done in the fourth season is frightening and a mystery. While their Seasons One to Three presentations were technically unremarkable, much of that due to the original materials, at least the episodes remained intact and were presented as they were originally on ABC and the VHS release of the Columbia House series in the 1990s For some reason, Sony opted to edit the fourth season of `` Soap \'\' by cutting out most of the summaries prior to the episode (`` In the last episode of \'Soap\' ... \'\'), some of which they were quite intelligent and none of which consumed more than 40 or less seconds of time. Worse still, Sony has edited the last five episodes of an hour of the season in ten half hours, omitting full scenes and essentially including heavily edited syndicated versions of the final stage of the series. (I do not know if these are the syndicated versions of these episodes, but they are significantly different from the episodes, as they appeared on the Columbia House tapes, which offered uncut episodes as they appeared on ABC in 1981). full and complete versions of \'\' Soap \'\' Seasons 1-3, this poor quality and incomplete packaging of season 4 is an enigma, a disappointment and value only for fans who only have to have the entire series on DVD. Otherwise, the true fans of the unedited, unedited series should cling, or find, the last year of `` Soap \'\' on VHS and suffer the inferior quality until Sony justifies it.'

b"This movie barely touches the holocaust. Some of the scenes showing the holocaust were actually scenes of when the people were released, not when they were taken to the camp, which made me think that the movie was simply united, taking some scenes from youtube. I could probably say in a whisper the amount that was quoted from the diary. It is more a film about a woman who does not get along with her mother, is popular on her radio show and her marriage is in trouble. Then there are some things about a woman in Poland who left her diary to her daughter. It's not a good movie, no matter what labels you put on because the acting is bad and the story is worse. Save your money and skip this one."

b"This is a great movie that describes the events of the hijacking of Air France Flight 139 and Operation Thunderbolt (later called Operation Yonatan) with precision and in great detail. The film keeps you on the edge of your seat and as events unfold. I saw this movie on the History Channel, on Real to Reel, presented by Steve Gitland, and I enjoyed it so much that I went and bought the DVD here on Amazon. I received the 2007 remastered version distributed by WHAM! U.S . The quality of the image is bad on this album, but my biggest disappointment is that several memorable scenes are missing. There is at least one notable leap in the movie. Some of the scenes I saw on television, but not on this DVD are the following: - The part where the passports were taken to the hostages.- When Daniel Cooper's son is informed by a French airport official about the fate of the flight of his father. An exchange between two hostages for trying to see the television cameras during one of the visits of Idi Amin. All scenes show the release of non-Israeli hostages returning home. - A Catholic nun who insisted on staying with the rest of the hostages. All these memorable scenes, which I hoped to see again, have disappeared! Although the raid itself seems largely intact, but the scenes are so dark that I had to rely on the memory of the television version of the film to know what was happening. In general, excellent movie, bad DVD! I will avoid all WHAM products! USA UU In the future."

b"I can not believe that Good Times Video has actually released this DVD without making any retouching, not even trying to get a better copy before making the DVD. b"Currently, this is the only version of Nobody 's Fool available on DVD. The fact that you get a double undercard from Paul Newman for the same price as a single title is just a bonus. Nobody is a fool is one of my favorite dramas and one of the last great roles of Newman, since his luck Sully. The whole cast shines; You could say that this is the best work you've seen of Melanie Griffith and Bruce Willis. If we add to this the final role of Philip Seymour Hoffman and Jessica Tandy, winner of an Oscar before the Oscar, will have a film that should not be missed and a treasure of its own. I like Richard Russo's books. I'm a fan of Mohawk, Nobody 's Fool and the winner of the Pulitzer Prize Empire Falls. The last book was translated into an HBO miniseries, Empire Falls, which surprisingly also includes performances by Paul Newman and Philip Seymour Hoffman. However, Newman won only one Oscar, as Best Actor for his role in The Color of Money in 1986. However, Newman exudes a charm as informal as Sully in Nobody 's Fool, which is still my favorite of the two. Rating: Five stars.P.S. I'm not a big fan of `` Fat Man & Little Boy ''. Unlike Nobody's Fool, the historical drama does not have the charm and humor that I prefer for repeated visits."

b"This training was great. I completed it 15 minutes ago and I can definitely feel it now. The training is divided into 5 segments of 10 minutes, which is a format that I love, because it means that you can decompose it for a shorter training and, even if you do everything, it does not seem like an eternity due to the changes segments. The general idea is to do strengthening exercises followed by stretching to lengthen the muscles. Overview of the segments: Weapons: this was probably my least favorite segment. I prefer the arm segment in 10 minute perfect body pilates solutions. They were around 6-7 minutes of work with arms and then 3-4 of stretching arms. He felt rushed and the indication seemed a little discouraged. Also, I just did not find it very difficult. For this segment you need light weights. High: this segment was excellent. They claim that you need a chair to do these exercises, however, if you have reasonably strong thighs and a good balance, it is not necessary. These exercises make you feel your thighs, mine began to tremble like crazy at one point and are really effective. Buttocks: I think this was the most difficult segment of the DVD. I really like that they had a segment dedicated especially to the glutes, a lot of videos with thighs and I do not think they work much. In this segment, the glutes will work hard, and a chair is an absolute necessity. I had to take several breaks during the same, but I am willing to work up to the entire segment. Absolutely: I'm happy that this segment was short because, although it was a good job for the abs, it was a bit boring. You put your feet on the wall and you keep in a position of abs (do not think it sounds difficult, I did not try to do it for about 8 minutes) and then I made variations from there. It's not my favorite ab training but it's effective, I definitely felt my abs straining. Stretching: I really like it when DVDs have a specific long segment dedicated to stretching. That said, this was not my favorite stretch segment. I wish the sections would have been a little less long and there would have been more different sections. He finished and still felt the need to do other stretches to feel really stretched. But the stretches they did were good, and there's something to be said to keep them going for so long and really make your body relax in the stretch. In general, I definitely recommend buying this video. It's a really effective workout and I certainly liked all the segments enough to keep doing it even if they were not my favorites. I also liked that they had two instructors, a man and a woman, and they showed simpler variations of many of the movements, even when it was better to rest if you needed it. A scam that I have not yet mentioned (and this is a matter of personal preference) is that the instruction is a voiceover that is not my favorite and sometimes I felt that the indication was not correct. Final thought: for $ 15 it's worth it!"

b'Every year, as a child, I expected to see Rudolph, the red-nosed reindeer, during the holidays. In fact, I expected to see him on television even as an adult! Wanting to share this great classic with my 7 year old son, I bought it a few weeks ago. Sure, I recorded it on a VHS along with other Christmas classics, but the quality was not so good and we had to endure commercials. The DVD version seems to be clean of the TV version in terms of quality. I seem to remember more "fuzzies" in the background when I was on TV (maybe the DVD was remastered?) The claymation video of Desinty \'s Child is basically useless, in my opinion, unless you have a little fan of this type . of music (and I do not). With a run time of 65 minutes, this DVD has hardly any extras. There is a lost scene that originally went on the air instead of the song `` Why am I so misfit? \'\' (an optimistic melody about attacking and finding your fortune). You can also watch the DVD in Spanish, and my son gets a kick to do it from time to time. The `` previews \'\' for other DVDs, including an annoying promotion for one on Peter Rabbit / Easter, seems ENDLESS. It\'s a shame how they announce to death on DVD for young people! And as for the story of Rudolph: well, it always bothered me that Rudolph\'s father rejected him for being different, and also Santa himself! Very disappointing, but is not that how life, where people judge according to appearances? Still, I love the songs about Rudolph, the red-nosed reindeer, and Hermie, the dentist he wants to be, Yukon Cornelius and the Bumble bring a warm festive nostalgia to our house. And my 7 year old son plays this DVD at least once a day! What more can you ask? (except maybe some fun extras).'

b"After their first year of college, the gang gathers again to relax and have fun. After a party in Stiflers, which resembles almost exactly the first film, the gang decides to take their adventures to a beach house and spend the summer there. While trying to find jobs and organize parties on the beach, the boys have to deal with some of their own dilemmas. Jim discovers that Nadia is back in the United States after she was fired from them after her internet debacle. However, Jim has only had sex one and a half times since that incident. So, to try to prepare for Nadia, she takes the help of Michelle, the geek gang that shook her world for a year. When she begins to teach him the forms of sexual behavior, they themselves begin to realize that maybe they are more than they think they are for each other. Kevin, after separating from Vicky, has to overcome his feelings for her once he shows up at the house to have fun. Because for her, they're just friends, and that's why she now has a new boy in her life. Oz has to deal with a long distance relationship with Heather since she left for the summer. However, it does not help that your best friend, Stifler, is constantly trying to have sex with any girl less than 3 yards from them. Speaking of Stifler, he's still dealing with the fact that Finch had sex with his mother last year. And Finch is having recalls of not being with Stifler's mother. For a long time, I thought that part 1 was the best of these 2. I seriously believe that I have been wrong all this time. After seeing them back the night before, I can honestly tell you that I laughed a lot more with part 2. The jokes are better and even more spicy. The embarrassing situations that Jim goes through are hilarious (my God, the super glue scene). The girls are hotter. And Stifle maybe just a little on the top, but it's still much better in part 2. When he grabs that dildo and shakes it while running through that house, I could not stop laughing. And when he says he forgot where he found it, it was the cause of all the excitement when he found out it was just funny. The lesbian scene just laughed graciously too. In the end, you would definitely own this. But remember, if you do not like coarse and rude comedy, stay away.P.S. - There is no way that any heterosexual man had left the house of light without having done something with Nadia. No way."

b"Alice Walker is a great pioneer. She is one of those African-American women who deserves all our love and adoration. She explores in this film, and behind it in the book, the slow and progressive liberation of black women from their slave slavery. Everything must start in their heads. They must find the courage to develop their own personality and freedom in the closed jail of their skulls, and then, little by little, they find the strength and the power to resist men, and then society, and then to overcome them . Liberation is a mental process that finds its full power when it is made public and views society as the natural field of its realization. The film is moving, moving, sensitive, intelligent, sentimental and tremendously powerful, if it is not pregnant with the most universal language we can imagine, the language of the liberation of women seen as the first step of the liberation of humanity. Alice Walker is universal in this story and deals with everyone and with every human being. What's more, no one is lost, no one is abandoned on the side of the road, no one is wasted forever for the cause of liberation. Even the worst tyrant will find in his moral depth the idea and the initiative that will make him free along with others, along with those whom he has exalted for decades. The husband pays the immigration of the African husband and family of his wife's sister. And he does it for nothing, because he stays on the sidelines and does not claim what belongs to him. Salvation is for all or it will not be. Dr Jacques COULARDEAU, Paris Universities II and IX."

b'First, I must clarify. The first time I saw Full Metal Jacket in its original theatrical version. Especially what remained with me was the scene in the head that ends the second third of the film. I bought it on the recommendation of my son, a newly commissioned second lieutenant of the Marines. He calls FMJ the `` Marine Movie. "It also calls the period of time" a shameful chapter in the history of the Marine Corps. "The routine abuse of the recruits represented in the film does not happen anymore, but the film is right in both aspects, and maritime training, even thirty years later, is as demanding as Kubrick describes. `` Indestructible men (and now, women) \'\' who can kill as many enemies as possible.The experience of Marines in combat, especially in Vietnam, is as the film demonstrates.As it undergoes a training that He will train him to lead a platoon, I asked my son about the incident that leads to the second death in cold blood, could it have happened that the Marines would be so lost that they would be at the mercy of a sniper? Absolutely, he replied, adding that Marines see the prospect of urban war with fear: "There are an infinite number of places where the enemy could be." In addition, he said, Cowboy made the right decision, even though it turned out Although I was on the streets in a different way during Vietnam (and I could not have seen the fight anyway, I\'m blind in my right eye and in my right hand), I\'m convinced that Semper Fi is real. `Semper Fi, do or die, gung ho, gung, ho, gung ho. "The Marines are actually the best we have, the inspiration for Army Rangers and Delta Force and Navy SEALS, they\'ve raised the bar in a way I did not appreciate, run, do not walk, to watch this movie.'

b"If you are looking for a great movie to watch with the family that can entertain your children on a rainy day, this is definitely your movie. It can make you and your children laugh on the floor, but still have some moments of mild fear. This movie is based on Dennis, a 5 year old boy who gets into many problems due to his curiosity. He lives next to old Mr. Wilson, who is often the recipient of Dennis's curiosity. Meanwhile, a thief crosses the city and begins to steal the house. In general, this is a classic movie that never ages and has 93 minutes of great entertainment. This movie definitely deserves 5 stars."

b'No one can soak a book in a spooky, damp atmosphere like Neil Gaiman, infused with humor and more than a little horror. Fortunately, that flavor remains alive in the film adaptation of `` Coraline \'\', brought to life by the talented Henry Selick. It\'s a scary little fairytale full of dilapidated apartments, dancing rats and soulless doppelgangers, as well as a brave heroine who finds himself in this ominous "other" world. Moved to an old apartment, Coraline (Dakota Fanning)) is boring. Her parents are too busy to do something with her, and her neighbors are crazy or bored. The only exception is Wybie, a boy who bothers her without end. It\'s the kind of implacably boring world that any little girl would want to escape, until Coraline does. She finds herself with a plastered door and a colorful wormhole, leading to a doppelganger back home. In fact, it is so similar that it has an "other mother" with button eyes (Teri Hatcher) and an "other father" (John Hodgman), in addition to good food, games, a gleaming magical garden, a chorus of circus rodents and magic toys. At first Coraline is fascinated by the other world, especially because her other parents are as attentive as her real ones are not. Then she finds her true parents sealed inside a mirror. With the help of a sarcastic cat, Coraline returns to the other world. But with her parents and a trio of children killed as hostages, Coraline\'s only hope is to bet on her own freedom, and she will be trapped forever if she fails. Neil Gaiman\'s book `` Coraline \'\' is a brilliant dark fairy tale environment: decaying apartments, dead children, cobwebs, beetles, disembodied hands, button eyes, and a woman with insect-button eyes who wants to claim Coraline for her. It is a fairytale world that becomes a nightmare kingdom where souls are lost and horrible things fall into the shadows. Most directors would turn the story into an uncomplicated matter ... but not the director of `` The Nightmare Before Christmas \'\' and `` James and the giant peach. "Instead, Selick gives it a dark, cobwebby atmosphere, bright colors and surreal details (the button that outshines the moon) and is full of charming details that might have been foolish (the hand of the creepy claw) but that They work brilliantly.The story begins simply as surreal, but becomes more frightening and spooky as the film unravels, and in the last third, the slow story suddenly turns into a completely spooky territory, and a truly frightening climax where the Other Mother shows her true self And along the way, there are a lot of wonderfully spooky moments: the three ghosts in a bedroom / rotten mirror, the offer of buttons and thick black thread, strange circus acts and much more The horror is subtle, the delicious spooky is not. Coraline, the Alice in this Notsowonderland, is a wonderful little heroine: strong, sensible, self-sufficient but still quite scared by what happens around her. Normally I\'m not crazy about Dakota Fanning, but only by voice is quite good in this role. The sarcastic cat is a wonderful counterpoint, and the original character of the movie, Wybie, is a good companion (although strange). And the other mother is the subject of nightmares: she is completely inhuman and ruthless, and by the climax of the movie it has become a nightmare. Oh, and French and Saunders make a couple of funny cameos like crazy neighbors. `` Coraline \'\' is a brilliantly dark little movie, full of dark magic and mysterious creatures, definitely for Gaiman fans, dark fantasy and really spooky things.'

b"In my review of the Fallen album, I quoted Lemmy from Motorhead saying that the album was above and beyond the line of duty. The rest of the appointment was that he felt they could not do it live. Well, I have to disagree with Mr. Kilminster for having seen the 'World Domination' tour in his Australian stage. I have to say that the band sounded perfect. And this CD shows that you can really fill the sound mix like in your advance album. This is really something unimportant in terms of audio. The sound is fine, the band is tight, which is interesting given the personal dramas of the time. The noise of the crowd seems to have been introduced and eliminated, although that is a fairly regular situation. The main difference between these Fallen songs and their live versions here is that the sound sounds a little deeper. It really is a work of cash in his fame. Taking out a live album when you have a catalog without backup is a bit cheeky. It also serves to fill the gap between their albums: the aforementioned personnel uprisings have undoubtedly played their part. It is not that filling the time between albums with live releases and curiosities is a new idea (G'n'R Lies anyone?). For fans of this band, this is probably essential to listen. The songs sound good, the crowd loves them properly and they are a nice project. Three stars for the strength of the songs and because it does not feel as if there have been massive overdoses. The fourth star of the extra DVD that shows the band is putting in value. However, they also sold the DVD separately for a while. Make sure you get this version with the DVD already in it, since it's really worth seeing."

b"4.6 starsI love this movie, and I think both the script and Ford do justice to the original and beloved television series. However, I do not think that this blu-ray transfer does much justice to the original impression; although it is a good and clear image, it does not improve my DVD much. The film itself is an excellent adaptation of the series, and Big Pharma's conspiracy angle is an excellent update that works well. There are many emotions, with minimal violence, which I appreciate more every year, as idiot directors and writers rely on weapons and blood to fill the gaps in their badly planned plots. There is more intelligence than that at work here, and director Andrew Davis makes everything fit with strength and suspense. The ending is a bit weak: I did not buy the scene at the conference, but it works to the degree that it should, and that is enough. Add Ford and Jones at the top of their games and it's a movie worth watching many times, every time you have to remember what a really good thriller can be. Too bad, they did not polish it enough to be a blu-ray worthy of the HD description."

b'The problem with New Moon is that it takes itself very seriously while giving the public many reasons to consider it a joke. I try not to read too much in the movies, and I think that people are responsible for their own actions, but I agree that this movie has an influence on young girls, and yes, older women too. Once I was in high school, and much of the dialogue was like what I remembered hearing between boyfriends and girlfriends. You know, on the day you fell in love a lot and were the love of your life? Then, 3 weeks later, BOTH you pass to another "love of your life". "This is how the dialogue sounds. It\'s corny, exaggerated, and I\'m sorry for teenagers who think this is what it should be. Edward and Bella have an obsessive and codependent relationship. Abandoned by a vampire so you feel suicidal? For real ? If you take out vampire things, everything else is still wrong. Bella is a creature without personality, without emotions, without a sense of humor, without goals, completely empty of a girl. It\'s really hard to understand why any of these guys find her attractive. What she does ? For her or for someone? She is a great burden and treats her father like shit. It just is not credible that two guys are willing to die (one again) for her. She does not offer anything in return. She is abandoned by Ed and only eats the attention that Jacob pays her without any intention of reciprocating her feelings. We call that leader. Everything is about her to the fullest. What I find particularly entertaining is that he asks Jacob if he could stop being a wolf ... but this same girl would never ask Edward that. Has no sense . Lautner did the best performance of the three, and made me feel for Jake. I read the Wiki page of the book Breaking Dawn and the result for your character sounds like the recipe for a movie for disaster. At this point, producers must stop leading young girls. Honestly, he saved the movie. As an adult, I can only handle so much teenage anguish and the fact that he broke some smiles prevented me from turning it off. When the werewolf first came out of the forest before pursuing Victoria, that\'s fine, yes, I thought he was a bear. But still, the werewolf scenes were the best parts. The vampire makeup was terrible and the contacts distracted. Pattinson was better in the first movie. Stewart was the same non-entity. She was so unmatched. Even if it is not in the dialogue, gestures, facial expressions and actions can convey a lot about a character. It\'s hard to believe that Bella is not a robot. Even on the DVD cover, she just does not try it. Compared with both male clients. The actors should be able to sell the motivations of their characters. Stanley in `Streetcar \'was totally reprehensible, but Brando sold it. Stewart does not, and therefore, Bella is one of the most unworthy "heroines" in history. Never, I\'m not going to stop here.'

b"Good movies about the & quot; Great War & quot; (as the First World War was known before there was a second) are few and far between. After & quot; All in silence on the western front & quot; and & quot; Paths of Glory & quot; the list is quite short This movie does not live up to those standards, but it's still an excellent movie. In general terms, the film is quite accurate in terms of its description of the combat of the First World War. The battle scenes come so close to & quot; Save Private Ryan & quot; level of realism as you can get on commercial television. Note that some scenes, especially the & quot; Friendly fire & quot; artillery attack, they are not for the apprehensive. The cast of support is a colorful and original collection of characters, devoid of most of the usual clich\xc3\xa9s of war movies. You could not look at a character and say if he would be dead or not by the end of the movie. It was easy to imagine that these characters had been ripped from a New York street around 1918. Rick Schroeder offers a first-class performance as Whittlesey's greatest conflict, divided between doing his duty and the well-being of his men. There are some moments where the movie hits a false note. Whittlesey's car at first was probably not built for 15 years after the Great War ended. The scene where the commander receives his orders seems to ignore the military protocol. And in a great failure of continuity, Whittlesey's executive office talks about the artillery shelling that had happened that day, when it had happened the previous day. These are only minor bumps in a first class effort."

b"Yes, Keanu Reeves actually plays the villain in this wonderful and magical film of romance, jealousy, romance, betrayal and honor set in Renaissance Italy. Created and starring Kenneth Branagh, this remake of one of Shakespeare's comedies is probably the most entertaining and fun movie based on one of Bard's plays. The cast includes many big names from both sides of the Atlantic, such as Denzel Washington, Emma Thompson and Michael Keaton, and the heroine is Kate Beckinsale's first great performance. The dialogue in the film remains true to the original work and the setting is probably as close as possible to what Shakespeare imagined. The best of everything is music; Classic style but original composition. I enjoyed watching this movie again and again, and so do you."

b"This DVD has my favorite soundtrack for this movie, however, it is not synchronized with the video! (which basically ruins it) The chapter selection also has flaws: there are only 4 chapter selections to choose from; Chapter 2 is labeled as Chapter 1, and so on ... so there is no selection for Chapter 1. The title menu is also extremely cheap, showing a small photo of the cover of the DVD box on a background that resembles very much the old Windows 95 'blue sky with clouds'. Last, and certainly not least, the quality of the video is terrible. Probably not worth it unless you are planning to remaster the DVD with the soundtrack in sync with the video for personal use and with a decent chapter selection menu. . I hope to find that someone has already put a good version along with this soundtrack on dvd (I know it exists in vhs)."

b"These days Uwe Boll has become a kind of joke among fans of the genre. With titles like Alone in the Dark and House of the Dead on his r\xc3\xa9sum\xc3\xa9, the German director has become synomynous with hack work crapfests. The seals of the weakest can be of the horror genre. I suppose it is a little insensitive that we, the fans, taste so much the pursuit of Boll's attacks, but if the man did not try to force excuses and defend his work in the interviews, he would be much more willing to reduce it. It is one thing to make a terrible film and defend it through a delusional assumption that it is somehow good, but another is to try to cover yourself when you know you are making a mess. I patiently await the half-hearted defenses of Bloodrayne's Uwe. As in all these half-done, video game rapidies, the plot is irrelevant. That does not mean that you could not produce a story of offspring on the character of Rayne, but it certainly was not good. The script is the first culprit. It appears as something that I wrote in the tenth grade English class. All imaginable clich\xc3\xa9s are on display. It's as if screenwriter Guinevere Turner had an encyclopedia of banalities. I suppose the excuse could be that she is new to these types of pieces, but let's go. The world has no meaning and is full of things incongruent with its old world environment. But in spite of these anachronisms, the dialogue is nothing more than harsh and antiquated words with a comic aversion to the contractions in sentences. The various plot machinations that provide the impetus for the actions of the characters always remain vague and irrelevant. There is very little here for the actors to work on. It is not that they try hard. Nobody here seemed to give a shit, which is understandable. However, there is humor in the delivery of clumsy and forced lines of many of the actors. It almost seemed as if some of them, (Michael Madsen and Michele Rodriquez most obviously), were reading the dialogue on a reference card for the first time. b'Forbidden Planet is perhaps the preeminent work of the scientific fantasy of the fifties. It is not, far from it, difficult science fiction, but in its way it is a thoughtful and intelligent offer. Famous (but very vaguely) based on Shakespeare\'s "The Tempest", this is a film where there are as many potential layers of meaning as you want to find. With Morbius chosen as Prospero, and Prospero in turn probably based on the Elizabethan wizard Dr. John Dee, co-creator of Enochian\'s magical language, is it really a coincidence that Morbius is himself a linguist? There\'s a lot more I\'d like to say here, but I\'m lagging behind for the sake of those who are not familiar with the movie. I do not want to give away any spoilers. For those who have seen the film, and who feel inclined towards such exercises, I will only ask this: to whom - or what - would they assign the respective roles of Ariel and Caliban? How would you fit your answers with the broader themes of the movie? And what do your answers suggest about how matter and spirit were conceived respectively in the minds of the Elizabethans versus the Americans of the 1950s? Only something to think about. For those who have not yet seen Forbidden Planet, I would say first of all that this is a wonderful movie that works perfectly well at the level of a direct adventure that a 10 year old could enjoy. As a piece of science fiction, I only emphasized that the depths you will find are of philosophy rather than science; although the classic technological themes of science fiction of the fifties are developed metaphorically. Happily, however, the reds under the bed / saucers in the sky metaphor that became a clich\xc3\xa9 and eacute; In much of the science fiction of the day nothing is found. One thing I want to add before going on is that it\'s worth watching this movie just for the set design. If you consider it classic or outdated, it\'s up to you; but for me I will simply say that I have never seen the visual lexicon of science fiction of the 1950s expressed more fully. Alright then: so much for the movie. How about the DVD? Well, I\'m happy to say it\'s amazing! The quality of the image is beautiful, and there are LOADS of extras and also very good. We get lots of vintage promotional material, which includes behind-the-scenes background material and even an additional movie for children that Robbie the Robot also used as an accessory. By the way, because I\'ve seen some criticisms that I\'ve written appear for editions or releases that are not for those who originally wrote them, let me emphasize that I\'m writing all this about Forbidden Planet (Special Edition of two albums). If you look at my profile Critical, you\'ll see that I\'m not one of those critics who delivers five-star raves as candy. But if you have any interest in classical science fiction, this is a movie you MUST see. And if you\'re looking for the best possible DVD version, to the best of my knowledge, that\'s the way it is. The O.'

b"Donald O'Connor plays Aladdin as the hero and the comic relief in this Arab night fantasy. Conspicuously American in a cast that seems largely European, O'Connor's Aladdin has humble beginnings but never allows his lack of means (or any concrete idea to acquire any) to dampen his dreams of greatness. When he discovers that his new lamp contains a genie that will grant him three wishes, his opportunity for greatness may finally have come true. No one believes him, least of all the lovely Djalma, who has spent years waiting for him to abandon his dreams, settle down and marry her. Assured of his deepest desires, Aladdin travels to Basorah, a large nearby city, which already celebrates the impending marriage of the sultan's daughter to the young but wise Molook. Meanwhile, the evil vizier of the prince conspires to kill Mollook and steal both his crown and his bride and, without male heirs of the sultan, the sultan's crown as well. When he stumbles upon the plan, Aladdin carries out an unlikely rescue with the help of the cunning prince and the population of fakir and beggars of Basorah. It was a funny movie and for some reason overlooked. It's fine for children, not very violent (except for two scenes, both involving a doll made to look like a real and exotic beautiful woman, and designed to crush to death those who are wrong in their embrace) and manages to see Very Hollywood and also very convincingly Arab at the same time. Donald O'Connor manages to steal all the scenes in which he is. This was the kind of movie that used to be on TNT every two months, but it has not been for years, so take this tape."

b'* \'\' The Defiant Ones \'\' is one of those rare movies that, after being seen only once, had the ability to stay with me for a lifetime! (Other gems that have had a similar effect on me include Chaplin\'s first \'talkie\', `` The Great Dictator \'\', the original `` Night of the Living Dead \'\', the corny and horrible but fun science fiction cult movie `` Laserblast \'\', and `` Citizen Kane \'\' by Orson Welles). I just had the opportunity to buy the DVD and watch this movie for the second time, and it was as good and intense as I remember from the first time! \'\' The Defiant Ones \'\' brings together the legendary Tony Curtis and the equally legendary and talented Sidney Poitier as convicted felons John `` Joker \'\' Jackson and Noah Cullen who, as a result of a physical skirmish between the two, contribute in part of the road accident in which your transport vehicle is involved. The resulting accident gives these two prisoners in chains the opportunity to escape on foot. But this is before the 60s of the southern United States, so when the law enforcement officers who arrive responsible for tracking the prisoners discover that the two conspirators escaped together have different racial backgrounds, they become somewhat negligent in their search, assuming erroneously that the two escaped would probably kill each other out of racial hatred before they even reach five miles. Forced to cooperate despite the racial tensions between them, Joker and Noah do not take their situation lightly and are constantly on the move to stay as far away from their persecutors as possible. In the days that follow, both men form a kind of uncomfortable camaraderie, and the conversations they engage with each other really seem to help soften some of those racial tensions they exhibit with each other, where each man gains a certain amount of respect for the other. . Joker is also made to face some unpleasant realities, like being forced to admit in his heart that Noah is the more rational of the two and, especially, having to accept the fact that his white skin is not a safety net when he is a fugitive criminal fleeing. There is also a story of \'human interest\' in the secondary plot of the film, part of it somewhat ahead of its time: the County Sheriff becomes the catalyst that prevents the persecution from becoming a careless and messy `` Good Ol \'Boy\' \'pistols, dawgs and testosterone, and one of the people of the village, played by the legendary Lon Chaney Jr., prevents the citizenship of a city from becoming an emotionally irrational lynch mob. Cinematography is excellent for a film of its time, although some of the sets could have been better constructed and arranged (for example, there is a set where the lights of the city of Los Angeles shine in the background beyond the studio lot). It\'s also nice to hear actors speaking with Southern accents that do not sound like "Foghorn Leghorn" rejects. Even considering `` remaking \'\' this classic movie would not only be a terrible mistake, but would also be a virtual impossibility ... so I hope that no one in Hollyweird, or anywhere else, thinks about doing something like that. One thing, and so let this great piece of the history of film making stand on its own and continue to stand the test of time. * * *'

b'I am very disappointed with this movie. Especially since it seems that they are two different themes at the same time. On the one hand, the film interviews some experts in the field of philosophy and theology, who trace the history and progression of postmodern thought quite effectively. On the other hand, there are the two filmmakers who simply discuss their useless and sometimes irrelevant ideas for discussion. The Williamson brothers ask questions that have little to do with postmodernism and more to do with their own personal dissatisfaction with the church. It is as if they had made this film to launch their own ideas and publicize it as a film about postmodernity. While some of the interviews with experts are useful to clarify trends in postmodern thinking, this video as a whole is not useful as a whole.'

b'The bride with white hair 2 quickly followed the success of the original film, resuming the tragic story of Cho Yi-Hang (Leslie Cheung) and his forbidden love Lien Ni-Chang (Brigitte Lin). By betraying his sacred promise that he would never doubt his beloved, Cho has unleashed a monster. Ni-Chang\'s fury for Cho\'s betrayal makes her completely insane, transforming her into the white-haired witch who only lives to destroy all the living members of the Eight Clans, especially the Wu Tang clan to which Cho belongs. As for Cho, he has retired to Mount Shin Fung, guarding a mystical flower whose flowering (and which only blooms once every twenty years) can cleanse and restore the woman he still loves. Ten years have passed since the deadly night when Ni-Chang went mad and almost alone destroyed the Wu Tang clan. Only two members of the clan survive: Cho, who has been on duty at Mount Shin Fung under blizzard conditions all these years, and Kit, Cho\'s nephew (Sunny Chan). With the imminent marriage of Kit with Lyre (Joey Maan), there is an opportunity to expand the lineage, and so Ni-Chang stars the party, kidnaps the young bride and takes her to her private castle full of men -states, mortal women. There, Lyre is indoctrinated into the witch\'s philosophy "See a man, kill a man" and programmed to kill Kit with his own hands. The Eight Clans send their best warriors to try to kill the witch and rescue Lyre, but they are almost helpless against Ni-Chang, who uses his deadly hair as the most effective weapon (sounds weird, I know, but it works very well). It soon becomes clear that the only person who might be able to defeat the white witch is Cho Yi-Hang, and this sets the stage for a more unforgettable reunion between the two former lovers. This sequel is a more direct and action-oriented film. that the original The Bride With White Hair, and for that reason, I really found it more pleasant on the surface. Still, it lacks the depth and beauty of the original, largely because the two lovers do not meet face to face again until the final scene, although that meeting is worth the wait. Without a doubt, if you have seen and enjoyed the original, you will want to experience this sequel.'

b"First of all, you can not see this DVD if you're a kind of politically correct stranger. Each stereotype, from the metal heads, the religious father and the teacher of gender studies, is reinforced and beaten mercilessly with brutal sarcasm. So, if this can offend you, DO NOT SEE IT! ! ! There, now, if you can take things easy, and you like extremely ruthless comedies, Dirtbags is the movie for you! You get a group of college metalhead burns, each of them trying to reach a specific goal in life (usually involving women's sexual favors), and getting involved in crazy situations that usually do not get away, just one more fall in absolute degeneration. I'm sure there's some kind of thesis on this for all of you, college students ... maybe you can never achieve your goals through dishonest means. Oh, I do not think so. It probably does not make sense, but it does not matter! And you must love the characters, who are all so colorful and strange that no fiction could create them completely. These are real images of life ... In fact, I've seen professors of male gender studies and Ogre-gym guys, so this is stranger than fiction. As I said, this movie is politically incorrect. No, I withdraw that; it is an antipolitical correction. It's great to see that someone has gone to the extreme and completely mocked political correctness, exposing it for the absurdity to which it has been taken. If there are no other redeeming qualities of this film in the eyes of the general public, at least it is the social critique that makes South Park look as docile as Sesame Street. Random, computer-generated, cheesy graphics (the skeleton during pizza, man's romp around the campus, the bee flying inside the soda can, the girl drowning over and over and over in the river) add a touch of film B and give testimony of the ingenuity of home movies. Personally, I think these things are great. The scenes of random nudity are, in my humble opinion, more by simple randomness than by gratifying drooling on the part of the viewer. Why is there a scene of a naked lady for several minutes? Because it is random and so completely stupid that it becomes quite fun. However, I must downplay a star for two reasons: one, the fact that this DVD does not have chapter selections (you can only watch the movie until the end). ), and two, the sound. With the sound, there is always music, and sometimes this dominates the dialogue (extremely annoying!), And due to the low budget, some of the dialogues are not recorded by experts, so it is low on the mix anyway. The first When I saw this, I really did not understand it, but when I saw it a second time, I was laughing hysterically. Include a cameo by Peter Steele from Type O Negative, a fantastic soundtrack that includes Immolation, Candlemass and a bunch of ridiculous songs, and you'll have real pleasure! ... That is, if you are not afraid of NOT taking this seriously."

For the rebound part, it makes very few movements, not very imaginative, over and over again. When changing from one movement to another, the camera almost never focuses on the teacher's feet to see what he is doing, so it can only be guessed. The `` class '' is composed of a group of people rhythmically challenged and totally out of shape in the front garden of the Royal Hawaiian hotel. They do not exercise in unison at all, and the camera is usually in them, not in the teacher. You must have hand weights to do the program. For the abs part of the program, for a large part the cameraman forgot to focus the camera. The two people are just blurs. Also, it just does not make sense to do your abs or yoga or pilates movements on a rebounder. It is absolutely uncomfortable to do so, and you can get a much better workout if you do it on a mat, without getting hurt under the hard rebounder. While the exercises in the abdominal and yoga parts were good, I recommend getting a different DVD without rebound, such as Candlelight Yoga (very excellent) with Sara Ivanhoe. That has many of the same movements as the yoga part of this training, but safe, well taught, photographed professionally and, above all, ENTHUSIASM. This was just a very boring and repetitive video. The Urban Rebounding compilations are not perfect, but they are MUCH better."

b"An amazing movie made under almost impossible circumstances. Located in Paris in the 1840s along a low-class theaters district (the `Boulevard of Crime '), the main story is about a mime (played by Jean-Louis Barrault) that falls in love with` `a woman of experience '' - brilliantly played by Arletty. In an incredibly touching and delicate scene, Arletty begs Barrault to make love to him, but he does not take advantage of the moment and abandons her. Find lust in the arms of others. Other important characters include a degenerate philosopher / writer; an actor of Shakespeare; a rich count who `` keeps '' Arletty; and the woman who loves Barrault and finally marries him. But the love between Barrault and Arletty remains true through the years, although in the end, after spending a glorious night together, she leaves him forever. The performance is excellent in everything, although what makes the film a masterpiece is the writing of Jacques Prevert: the dialogue is simply brilliant. The film was filmed during the Nazi occupation and many of the actors left the set to leave and fight in the resistance. The sets were constantly moving to avoid bombing and Nazi interference, when possible. The movie has a duration of c.190 minutes; the Nazis had a law that said that no film could exceed 90 minutes, so it was done as TWO independent films. The film is not only a testament of love in all its passionate intensity (it's a French film, after all), but also of the survival of a country and a big city, Paris, a whole civilization, in fact, that suffers under the plank of a fierce oppressor: it is the light of love, culture and memory that always shine from the darkness of hell. An amazing achievement in all the phases of the process of making the film, from the message of the story to the sets, acting and photography: it is a film of all times."

b"Well, yesterday I saw this at Costco and I picked it up, since it's one of my favorite movies from my childhood. My younger brother and I used to rent this on VHS from our local rental location every year around the first of our summer vacations. The film itself is ideal for a movie made for TV, it is as good or better than the animation of the series. The show itself is five stars, so why do I only give it two stars? . . The quality stinks. If you put it on a computer and verify the size, it's only 3.7 GB, not even a full 8 GB DVD, so they chose a cheap disk and used a single DVD in layers. You can see this when you play it because it's an interlace DVD, Google's interlaced DVD for more information. Basically this is to play on OLD TVs, not on the current HDTVs. It also seems that they used an old VHS for the tear instead of using original sources or even a LaserDisc, those huge record size DVDs, had a much higher quality than VHS and did not degrade over time as VHS does. If they started one of those would look much better. They also did not take long to create menus, when you go to watch trailers and change language is a very boring light blue menu without sound. I could have done a better job with the free software in the menus. In addition, the records were made in Mexico, they could not even splurge enough to make them in the United States. I'm glad it's on DVD now, but I've been waiting for so long that it bothers me that it's of poor quality. I can improve the quality a bit by tearing it off and using a combination filter to get rid of the interlacing, but why the hell could not they have launched a higher quality product? I also know some people with LaserDisc players, I could buy the LaserDisc and have it ripped, burn it to a DVD and put it in this case. The casing is beautiful and it looks good with my other DVDs and Blurays."

b'In 1879, a British column was almost annihilated by a large "impi" of Zulu warriors near Isandhlwana. Later, a small British force camped at the nearby Rorke\'s Drift (a commercial station and a mission) which consisted of 104 fit soldiers and a number of invalids in a makeshift hospital that became the next target. For two days, the station was attacked by waves of Zulu warriors. The total number of attackers was approximately 4,500. In the end, nearly 400 Zulus were killed compared to only 20 of the defenders, the hospital was burned and 11 crossed victories were handed over to the survivors. The film itself is a reasonably faithful recreation of the events. in Rorke\'s Drift, with a good performance by Michael Caine, Stanley Baker and a great cast of Zulus. The ferocity of the assault, the stubborn and desperate defense of the small garrison and the chaos of hand-to-hand combat on the barricades can be felt through filmmaking. A wonderful aspect of this film is that the battle scenes were filmed using a large number of actors in the role of Zulu warriors, who obviously were able to recreate the tactics and movement of the true army of 1879. Their war cries, movements synchronized spear on shield and advance in formation create the sensation of a royal army moving to attack the apparently condemned garrison. This is one of the few films that gives the viewer an idea of \xe2\x80\x8b\xe2\x80\x8bwhat the combat should have been like in the days before the appearance of the mechanized armies on the scene.'

b"It's what you expected from the guys at Monty Python. It is silly, irreverent and completely strange. Erik the Viking is a dark comedy of light humor, and although that sounds like a possibility, those of you who have seen Monty Python and the Holy Grail or Brian's Life will understand. This will never be called a masterpiece of cinematography, acting or special effects. On the other hand, it is not meant to do so. The film achieves what it proposes. The charm of the film is to execute quite silly situations. From Vikings flying from the ends of the Earth to Erik fighting against a host of enemies thinking that he is invisible. The special effect hardly rivals that of other Python films made in the 70s, and this was done in 1989. The performances of the cast of Monty Python are not the best, however, they are entertaining and satisfying. The thing is that none of that is really important. Erik the Viking is a good and entertaining story with some thoughtful but subtle observations about the human condition and religion. Even dark things end up not being so depressing in the end. This DVD is really hard to find, and to make matters worse, Sony created a Director's Cut, but until now had never bothered to release it in the United States. If you have a free region DVD, there is a director's son cut available in the UK, so there is hope. If you find the rare launch without features of the USA. UU For a reasonable price, I recommend that you get it without a doubt, since Sony has not made any announcement to make any new issue. If you're a Monty Python fan, then, of course, look at Erik the Viking. Those of you who do not have Python-style humor will not appreciate this either. If you like the kind of humor mixed with some decent Nordic mythical stories (and do not criticize the low budgets of production), this movie should be a good distraction from reality."
